loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Oktaviana

texts.en:
A loan of Rp. 10.000.000 helps Oktaviana to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community. 

Oktaviana’s dream was to be a nurse but she couldn't afford the university degree due to financial difficulties. She and her husband run a mobile delivery business, bringing supplies such as toiletries and groceries to villages in Tambolaka using an old pick-up truck. They supply small shops who do not have access to transport to restock their product from the central market located far away in town. With this connection to remote villages in the area she is confident to sell technologies while selling wholesale products. When people ask about kerosene, she can explain about the health and cost benefits of replacing kerosene lamps with solar powered lights.                                                                                                                               
 
Oktaviana will use the loan to buy stock and grow her business. She is excited about Kopernik’s training program to learn about these new technologies, better promote them to her customers and improve her general business skills.

loans.use: To introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en: Leslie is an 18-year old college undergraduate and lives in La Carlota City. She is a single parent with 1 child aged 1-year and 6 months old. Leslie is living with her parents. Her father is a carpenter and her mother is a housewife. Their total monthly family income is only Php6,000.00 ($136). Leslie needs to help her family but didn't have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere's selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Leslie starts earning, she can help provide her family's basic needs and her child's education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá, Honduras. She works in agriculture, growing potatoes. She is 30 years old and married with four children. It is clear that Yolanda works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.

Yolanda is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras. It will permit her to have better lighting, charge her cell phones, and save in traditional energy expenditure. She hopes that with the solar energy system, her children will be able to continue studying and the living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending on kerosene and candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Raifa

texts.en:
Raifa is a 52 year old Palestinian woman living in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. Raifa works in retail, she buys used home furniture and appliances and resells them. Raifa is highly experienced in her line of work, and her business is getting more and more lucrative especially with all the Syrian refugees who are starting up their home in Lebanon. Raifa lives with her husband, who works as an construction worker, and her three kids. 
She requested this 1,234,327 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa to increase her business so she should provide better living conditions for her three kids.

loans.use: to buy used furniture and home appliances and resell them

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Said, a 26 year old Palestinian construction worker, is requesting a loan of 3,083,000 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He needs the loan to enhance his business by purchasing construction tools and finish the payments on his car which he uses for work. 
Said, who is also engaged, is living with his parents and three brothers in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. He has been working ever since he was a child in this field and has accumulated many years of experience. This reflects in the professionalism of his work and loyalty of his clients. He is also very easy to talk to and accessible, plus he has a nice taste which also reflects in his work. 
The loan will boost his business productivity and monthly income which will enable him to provide his brothers with better living conditions and start planning for his own future.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and a car

loans.name: Eva Ondina

texts.en:
Eva Ondina lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá, Honduras. She is a farmer who grows coffee. She is 30 years old and married with four children. It is clear that Eva Ondina works hard to support her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. 

Eva Ondina is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras. It will permit her to have better lighting, charge her cell phones, and save on traditional energy expenditure. She hopes that with the solar energy system, her children will be able to continue studying and that she will improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending on kerosene and candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Hycenth's group 210,000 Naira loan will help a member to purchase palm kernel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 49 year old Palestinian taxi driver who works inside a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. Throughout his career he has gained a very good reputation among his loyal clients. 
He is married and has a son, a painter who is planning on getting married soon, and a daughter who is still unemployed. His wife also being unemployed, Ali's income is the family's main source of income. 
After renting the taxi he was working on for more than 20 years, Ali saved enough money to get his own car in 2013, which got damaged in a car accident earlier this year.
He is asking for a 3,083,000 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. The loan will allow him to buy a new car and save the money he is currently paying on his rented car. He will therefore be able to spend more money on his household and provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new car

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna is a 40 year-old-woman from Baniswef. She is married with 3 school children. Her husband is a part time electrician so the family doesn't have a constant source of income. Thus, Hanna decided to help her husband with the monthly income by starting small clothing project in her house. Hanna requested a 5000 EPG loan at the beginning of her project and successfully repaid it on the due date. Now Hanna dreams of expanding her clothing business so she requested a 10,000 EPG loan to buy more clothes for her project.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to expand her project.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 36 year-old-woman from Baniswef. She has 3 sons and 2 daughters. Sabah's husband is an office assistant with a very small salary.  Four years ago, Sabah decided to start a small clothing business because her husband's income could not cover the family's monthly expenses. During the last few months Sabah was unable to meet her customer's demands because they needed some products that she doesn't have such as bedding and curtains. So she decided to request a 5000 EPG loan to buy a sewing machine and cloth since she has enough experience using such machines to sew beddings and curtains. She believes that this would increase her family's monthly income and improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and cloth to sew bedding and curtains to meet her customer's demands.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower is 40 years old and her 19 year-old son has just completed a long and complex medical treatment. The borrower opened a small convenience store eight years ago but she eventually had to close it due to stigmatization from her neighbors. She opened another store four years ago and, after her son started receiving medical treatment, she got to know Partners in Health Peru and joined their Income Generation project, a project which offers training in small businesses. 
In the area where she lives, her store was the only one that sold bread and coal, but she still needed to offer a variety of products as well as a photocopier because schoolchildren from the nearby school demanded this service. Partners In Health Peru supported her at the time, and her income has significantly approved. At present, she would like to purchase a freezer for dairy products, which are at risk of spoiling during the summer months. 
For the past two years, the borrower has been her family’s main provider; her husband cannot find regular work as he lost three fingers in an accident at a construction site, her four younger children are in school and her older son, now recovered, drives a rented taxi. The only stable income comes from the convenience store, which is why the borrower’s family help out with customers. An improvement in the store’s conditions will directly impact the family’s well being.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for dairy products for her convenience store

loans.name: Rabee

texts.en: Rabee is a 30 year-old-man and from Baniswef and is a graduate of an agricultural high school. He is married with 2 sons and a daughter and his father works as a part-time farmer but makes very little money due to his old age and deteriorated health condition. Rabee is the only bread winner of his family so he decided to start a small but unique fattening project, he wants to purchase two cows because nobody else in his village fattens cows. He requested a 7000 EPG loan to buy two cows for fattening.

loans.use: To buy two cows for fattening.

loans.name: Shabaan

texts.en: Shabaan is 47 year-old-man from Baniswef. He is married to a housewife and has 5 sons. Since Shabaan works in growing seasonal crops, he does not have a monthly constant income. Shabaan decided to start a small poultry project in a place he prepared on the roof of his house so he requested a loan from TADE to purchase poultry such as chickens, ducks, and geese to raise on the roof of his house for sale. Shabaan believes this project will provide a constant income to the family and improve their living condition.

loans.use: To purchase poultry such as chickens, ducks, and geese for sale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 31 year-old-man from Baniswef. He is married with 2 daughters and a son. His son is the oldest and is in elementary school. Mohammad is the only breadwinner of his the family since his father suffers from a serious disease. Thus, Mohammad wanted to start a small fattening project to increase his monthly income to cover his family's expenses and afford treatment and medication for his father. Consequently, he requested 8000 EPG loan to buy two head of cattle for fattening.

loans.use: To buy two head of cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Jhaneth

texts.es: Jhaneth esta casaday vive en El Alto en la casa de sus padres (la situación no es muy buena como para que pueda independizarse junto a su marido) en una casa de ladrillo y cemento La clienta es empleada de una fábrica y quiere un credito para hacer mejoras en la unidad habitacional que ocupa (dice que una ampliacion no le vendria mal) Jhaneth es la unica que trabaja, su marido perdio el empleo hace poco pero ella goza de buena salud y con el apoyo de kiva cree que mejorara su situacion
texts.en: Jhaneth is married and lives in El Alto in her parents' house (the situation isn't such that she could live independently with her husband). It is a brick and cement house. She works in a factory and she wants a loan to make improvements on the room she uses (she says that an addition wouldn't be bad for her). Jhaneth is the only one who works because her husband lost his job lost his job a short time ago, but she is in good health and with the support of Kiva she things she can improve their situation.

loans.use: to make improvements on her room.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 30-year-old, married, Palestinian refugee, who established his own car mechanic and maintenance garage three years ago. He has wide experience in this domain since he had to quit school during the intermediate stages and start working with his uncle to support his family with their living expenses.
 
Husein is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary spare parts and hardware to develop his business in a well-managed way.

This is Husein's seventh cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan really helped him to develop his business properly, and at the same time he proved to be a good standing borrower.

He hopes that in the future he can expand his working sector and start selling used-car spare parts.

loans.use: To buy necessary spare parts and hardware to develop his business in a well-managed way

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alba is 61 years old and resides in her own home along with her husband. She has been making and selling tortillas for several years. Her business is located at her place of residents and she has many customers.

Alba is requesting a loan in order to buy corn by the quintal (1 quintal = 100 kg) and lime powder so that she can continue producing tortillas. As a result, she will have a more income so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder for making tortillas.

loans.name: Somos Progreso Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Somos Progreso” La cual  está constituida por 10 socios responsables y solidarios. Ruth de 30 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica  a la venta de productos de nutrición y suplementos alimenticios(herbalife). Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus menores hijos. Su mayor deseo es contar con su propio local de venta para así ofrecer una variedad de sus productos. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de batidos de leche, concentrado de limón y aguas saborizadas. La Alcancía “Somos Progreso” agradece a todos a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar dicho crédito. Ruth es la cuarta del lado derecho y  viste polo rosado.
texts.en:
This is the communal bank "Somos Progreso". It is comprised of 10 responsible, supportive members.

Ruth, 30 years old, is married with two independent children. She makes a living selling nutritional products and food supplements (Herbalife). Thanks to her efforts, she has managed to improve the quality of life for herself and her minor children.

Her greatest wish is to have her own sales location so that she may offer a variety of products for sale. She is requesting the loan to buy milkshakes, lemon juice concentrate, and flavored waters.

The "Somos Progreso" communal bank is thankful to all Kiva lenders for making this loan possible. Ruth is the fourth from the right, and she wears a pink tee shirt.

loans.use: to buy milkshakes, lemon juice concentrate, and flavored waters.

loans.name: Luz De Fe Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Luz de Fe lo integran tres mujeres laboriosas, quien lo coordina es Isabel una mujer laboriosa de 36 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edad de 14 y 7 años, quienes han sido la mayor motivación para su superación, se ha dedicado desde hace cuatro años a la compra-venta de cosechas, comercializándolos en el mercado de la su municipalidad, es el cuarto ciclo que solicita en ADIM los financiamientos para su negocio y esta vez lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de mamón y nancite, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado diversificar los productos ofrecidos. El resto de los integrantes son Alba quien tiene la edad de 38 años de edad y se dedica a la elaboración de delantares, y Yovanelia una joven de 22 años de edad comerciante de ropa nueva en las calles de granada desde hace un año.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Luz de Fe is made of hardworking women. The one who coordinates the group is Isabel, a hardworking 36-year-old woman. She is married and she is the mother of two children, ages 14 and 7, who are the greatest motivation for her effort to rise above. For four years, she has made her living from the purchase and sale of fruits and vegetables, selling them in the market in her municipality.

This is the fourth cycle she has solicited a loan from ADIM to finance her business and this time, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of Spanish limes and nance. With her previous loans, she has achieved diversification of the products she offers.

The other members are Alba, who is 38 years old and makes her living making aprons, and Yoyanelia, a 22-year-old young woman who has sold news clothes in the streets for a year.

loans.use: to purchase of freshly harvested Spanish lime and nance, which will permit her to continue diversifying her products.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Lan is 48 years old, and she is married with three children. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Lan hopes to build a new house. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Hân

texts.en:
Mrs. Hân operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Hân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Hân is 36 years old, and she is married with five children. Hân lives with five dependents in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hân faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Hân hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Hernie

texts.en:
Hernie is a 47-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. Hernie runs a sari-sari, or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is her main source of income.

Hernie is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments, bread and snack foods. This loan will help her improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Hernie hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments, bread and snack foods

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy has been farming for more than 11 years, and he used his previous loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy two dairy cows.  

He plans to use this loan to buy cattle feed for his dairy cows. This will enable him to increase his milk production and thereby make more income. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more dairy cows. 

This is Sammy’s second loan from VisionFund Kenya, and he repaid his previous loan successfully. His future hopes are to buy more dairy cows and be successful.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed for his dairy cows

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 28 years. He is single.

Daniel is is a shopkeeper as well as a farmer, a business he has done for the last two years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 43,000.

He has requested his second loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 30,000, which he will use to buy a stock of retail goods for the shop, especially for this Christmas season. Such goods include sugar, salt, washing powder, bread, milk, and other household goods.

Daniel successfully repaid his previous loan. His hope and dream for the future is to be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy a stock of retail goods for the shop

loans.name: Nour

texts.en: Nour is a 21-year-old married lady. She recently became a mother, which led her to quit her job as a sales lady to look after her child. But looking after her child and quitting her job does not mean that she cannot have a job at home, so she decided to start selling blankets that she purchases at a wholesale price from the market. She is using her skills in selling to make new clients and more connections so she can expand her business. Now she is applying for a youth loan to increase the quantity of goods she has and to bring different styles and sizes to cover all needs.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of goods she has and to bring different styles and sizes to cover all needs.

loans.name: Seraj

texts.en: Seraj, an 18-year-old single lady, is a freshman student at the university. She has an older sister who is majoring in accounting to become like her mother, an accountant. Seraj was always dreaming of becoming a lawyer, wearing a lawyer’s gown and standing to defend wronged and innocent people. So she registered to study law to get to her dream. Now she is applying for a loan to help her pay for her next semester fees, as she knows how difficult it is to afford paying for two children at the university.

loans.use: To pay for her next semester fees

loans.name: Marah Group

texts.en: Mohammad and Marah are a brother and sister living with their parent in Salt. Mohammad is in his third year at the university majoring in programming engineering, while Marah is a fresh student at a different university majoring in information technology. After their father retired, he started working in another job because the retirement salary would not be enough to pay for both of his children at the university. On the other hand, Mohammad and Marah chose to apply for a group loan to pay for their semester fees and take that burden from their father’s back.

loans.use: To pay for their semester fees and take that burden from their father’s back.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos un hombre de 51 años de edad separado de su esposa quien se le llevo hasta la dentadura (broma), se dedica a la reparación de calzado, un negocio humilde que con el pasar del tiempo se han ido perdiendo quedando pocos zapateros tradicionales en los barrios.
Es padre de 2 hijos ya mayores de edad y con su familia y con la ayuda de su negocio Carlos puede llevar a su casa su alimento pues vive solo y su empresa le da el sustento.
Una de sus principales ventajas es que es de su sector el único zapatero, pero no es una profesión muy bien paga por ello en tiempos difíciles necesita de préstamos para sostenerse y tener con que trabajar.
Con la ayuda de un crédito quiere comprar insumos como lo son un nuevo martillo, puntillas, pegamentos, plantillas etc.
Tu apoyo será la mayor de las bendiciones para Carlos, ayúdalo.
texts.en:
Carlos, 51, is separated from his wife.  He is a cobbler, a simple business that is being lost over time, with few traditional shoemakers remaining in the neighborhoods.

He has two children who are now grown. With his family and with the help of his business, Carlos is able to put food on the table at his house, as he lives alone, supported by his business.

One of his big advantages is that he is the only shoemaker in his area; but it is not a job that pays very well.  That is why he needs loans during these difficult times, in order to keep going and have what he needs for working.  With the loan, he wants to purchase supplies such as a new hammer, tacks, adhesives, insoles, etc. 

This support and help will be a great blessing for Carlos.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as a hammer, tacks, adhesives, and insoles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Qusai

texts.en: Qusai is a 22-year-old single man who is going to university to get his bachelor's degree in accounting.  Qusai sometimes helps his father, who is also his role model, by working on his bus to transport goods by order. His father used to work in the university and retired, then he bought a bus so he can work to transport goods and offer his family a better life. Qusai is applying for an education loan to help him pay for his next semester fees, so he can decrease the pressure on his father in the meantime.

loans.use: To pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Shaymaa

texts.en:
Shaima, a 20 year old single lady, has been in love with History and Archeology since she was in school. Shaimaa lives in Ajloun where Ayyubid castle is (locally called Ajloun castle). 

When it came to decide what major she wanted to study, Shaima chose to major in Archeology maintenance and discovery without hesitating. Now she is in her second year and has faced some trouble in covering her semester fees. For that she is requesting a loan to do so.

loans.use: To pay her semester fees.

loans.name: Maymouna

texts.en:
Maymouna is 43 years old conservative woman and asked her husband Saleh to take her place in the photo. She is a teacher. After her husband has retired from the military, she suggested that he open a small book and stationary store to have another income and to make a better use of his free time.The store has been open for almost three years. During those years, they added a copy machine and more stationary items that would appeal to school-aged children.

Maymouna requested a loan, which her husband will use to do maintenance on the copy machine and purchase more notebooks and stationary items to prepare for the next semester.

loans.use: to do maintenance on the copy machine and purchase more notebooks and stationary items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for buy more small colorful small stones and colorful sand to make more small mosaic souvenirs and sand bottles for people to take back home.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 49-year-old conservative woman so she asked her son Daoud to take her place in the photo.
Elham is a mother for four boys and three girls. She was not able to continue with her studies after high school but wanted to make sure that all of her children have the chance to get the education she missed. Elham has managed to support all of her children in their education, and she still has her youngest Daoud, a 19 year old student in one of the public universities in Jordan. He is majoring in tourism management in his second year. Her other children worked hard to get their bachelor's degrees to make their parents, especially their mother, proud as she was the one insisting on education. As his brothers and sisters did before him, Daoud wants to get his bachelor's degree, find a job and let his parents rest. As she supported all of her children, Elham is trying to do the same with Daoud but does not have the money. She is requesting an educational loan to help him pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the quantity and the variety he has of snacks and to add a small section for stationary items to serve those children when needed.

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en: Hadeel is a 23 year old single lady, who is majoring in managerial information systems at one of the private universities in Jordan. Hadeel is in her third year now. Besides going to school, she is working to save up some pocket money. Hadeel is now requesting a loan in order to pay for her upcoming semester.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester

loans.name: Odai

texts.en: Odai is a 20-year-old single man living with his family in Ajloun. Odai is now in his second year at the university majoring in psychological guidance. As most of the boys, Odai’s hobby is to play soccer. Using that hobby along with his degree after graduation, Odai is planning to work in schools where he can make some kind of connection with the kids using sports to help in understanding them and providing them with guidance, especially the violent students. But now Odai is applying for this education loan so he can continue with his studies and pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.use: To pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.name: Munther

texts.en: Munther is a 21-year-old single man living with his seven member family in Al Mafraq. Because of the current political situation in the area, Munther decided that he wanted to be more involved in it and registered to major in political science. He is now in his third year but is facing some trouble with paying for his next year fees after the tuition costs have risen, and for that he is applying for this education loan.

loans.use: to pay for his next year fees after the tuition costs have risen.

loans.name: Mysoon

texts.en:
Maysoon is a conservative married woman so she asked her husband Sulaiman to take her place in the photo.

Maysoon is a 43-year-old mother of two children. She is a housewife who is trying to find a way to support her husband. Sulaiman has a small drinks shop where he offers hot and cold drinks like, coffee, tea, juice, etc. They want to redecorate the shop and buy a new coffee machine that makes cappuccino, hot chocolate, and other hot drinks besides the Turkish coffee that he makes to offer all warm drinks to people now in winter season. So Maysoon is applying for a loan to help her husband in buying the coffee machine and redecorating the shop to include two tables and chairs for people to wait at while their order is prepared.

loans.use: To pay for buying the coffee machine and redecorating the shop to include two tables and chairs for people to wait at while their order gets ready.

loans.name: Najmeh

texts.en:
Najmeh is a conservative divorced woman, so she asked her son Ahmad to take her place in the photo.

Najmeh is the mother of two children; both of them got their Bachelor's degree, and Ahmad is now continuing to get a higher degree in General Management. 

Ahmad is a male nurse at one of the hospitals in their area. He is facing some trouble in covering his semester fees. Najmeh came to request a loan to help her son in paying the rest of his semester fees.

loans.use: To help her son in paying the rest of his semester fees.

loans.name: Fabiola Amada

texts.es: Amada esta pasando por sus 50 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 aun viven con ella, y también le acompañan 4 nietos, Amada tiene su tiendita en una parte algo alejada de la ciudad y por este motivo si le va bien en sus ventas, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para tienda como confites, víveres y mas, la aspiración de Amada es readecuar su pequeño negocio y  mejorar sus ventas  para que sus ingresos le alcancen a cubrir los gastos suyos y de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amanda is 50 years old and is married with 3 children, 4 of whom still live with her. She also lives with 4 of her grandchildren. Amanda has a store in an area that is a bit far from the city center and for that reason if her sales go well she plans to invest the money from this loan in buying merchandise for the store, like candy and other food products. 

Amanda's goal is to adequately stock her small business and improve her sales so that her income covers her and her children's expenses.

loans.use: buy products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy canned food and other food products to sell, and to make new shelves to show those new items in the shop.

loans.name: Wilmer Geovanny

texts.es: Wilmer es un joven de 22 años de edad, el tiene unión libre con una joven con la que tiene un hijo de 2 años, comenta Wilmer que estaba estudiando y que la institución educativa se cerro y fue ahí que dejo sus estudios y se dedica a la agricultura, su esposa se dedica a ayudarle en su negocio de cultivos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para su negocio, la aspiración de este joven trabajador es de tener sanos sus cultivos con personas a las que les paga para que le ayuden en sus cultivos, Wilmer tiene el sueño de mejorar sus ingresos y retomar sus estudio.
texts.en: Wilmer is a 22 year old youth. He lives in a common-law relationship with a woman and they have a two year old child. Wilmer comments that he was studying in school but the educational institute closed so he left his studies and started to work in agriculture. His wife helps him in his business of growing crops. He will invest the loan buying manure and fungicides for his business. The hopes of this hard-working youth are to have healthy crops and have people who he pays to help him with his crops. Wilmer has the dream of improving his income and returning to his studies.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Bartolome

texts.en: Bartolome lives in an isolated community without access to the electric grid in Veracruz, the state with the third largest indigenous population in Mexico. He works in the field and cultivates oranges with which he makes his living and that of his family.  Despite his low income, he spends 20% of what he earns monthly in candles to light his house after the sunsets. This is around USD$27 per month invested in lightening of poor quality. Bartolome wants to buy a solar system to light his house at nights and give his children the opportunity to study for longer hours after school. The system would also provide enough light for his wife to cook more comfortably at nights. His investment will let him save some money after he pays the value of the system, which is very significant for his income´s economy.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will substitute the use of expensive candles with clean, durable and reliable energy

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 21-year-old single man, one of a six-member family living in Al Hashmiya, a sector in Zarqa Governorate. Raed is now in his third year, majoring in Information Systems. To be able to afford his school fees and buy the needed books every semester, Raed works as a school bus driver. He takes the children to school in the morning, goes to the university, and then comes back in the afternoon to bring the children back to their houses. 

Now Raed is short on money to pay for his next semester fees, so he requested an education loan to help him pay the university.

loans.use: To  pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia lives in San Martin, Puebla with her husband and children. Nadia works renting chairs and tables for parties. She got this idea while working in the city and managed to save enough to buy the equipment. Nadia is a hardworking entrepreneur that strives to give her family the best. Nadia has a piece of land neighboring her parents home and wishes to start building a home for her family. She has saved for the last year and is asking for a credit to buy the materials needed to start building her homes. Nadia has no access to credit from local institutions due to the informality of her job and because the land is under her parents name. She will receive technical training and supervision to make sure that the construction meets all quality and safety standards. Nadia wishes to give her family the security of their own home and hopefully grow old together.

loans.use: to start building her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Niels Irina

texts.es:
Niels es una joven de 22 años, nació en La Paz – Bolivia y vive junto a su mamá y sus dos hermanos menores, ella comenta que cuando tenía seis años su papá tuvo que dejar su hogar pues lamentablemente no podía conseguir un empleo fijo por lo que tuvo que tomar la decisión de irse a vivir a la ciudad de Santa Cruz para trabajar y de esta manera enviarles dinero para cubrir los gastos del hogar, sin embargo no volvió a vivir con su familia, pero se comunica con ella y sus hermanos continuamente.
Niels actualmente está cursando el décimo semestre de la carrera de Ingeniería Petrolera y cree firmemente que ser una buena alumna es la mejor manera que tiene para honrar y agradecer a sus padres por todo el esfuerzo que han hecho por ella y sus hermanos. 
Su sueño es especializarse en su profesión y poder brindar ayuda a jóvenes de escasos recursos; agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos le brindan la oportunidad de alcanzar su sueño.
texts.en:
Niels, 22, was born in La Paz, Bolivia, and lives with her mother and her two younger siblings.  She said that unfortunately her father had to leave home when she was six years old because he was unable to find a steady job.  He decided to go to the city of Santa Cruz to live and work, and he sent them money to cover the household expenses.  Even so, he didn't live with his family again, although he does communicate frequently with her and her siblings.

Niels is currently in the tenth semester of her program in petroleum engineering.  She firmly believes that being a good student is the best way she can honor and thank her parents for everything they've done for her and her siblings.

Her dream is to specialize in her profession and be able to help low-income youth.  She's grateful to the people who are using their financial resources to give her the chance to realize her dream.

loans.use: to pay for her petroleum engineering program

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria lives in Hueyapan with her two young sons. Maria's husband lives in another country working hard so that his family can have a better life. She also works every day selling fruits and vegetables in the market. Maria has been saving some of the money she makes to build a proper home. She has been saving for the last year to build a roof on her house that is almost finished. She has managed to almost finish building her house, but to move in she needs to replace the bag that is currently working as a roof. She now needs a loan to finish paying for the materials and complete the home. Since she does not have a formal job and no way to prove her income, she does not have access to credit from other institutions. Maria is really looking forward to giver her sons a home that they can feel proud of and where hopefully one day her husband will return. She will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to make sure the construction meets all the quality and safety standards. Maria knows that this can only be achieved trough hard work and sacrifice.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a roof on for her house that is under construction

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en: Nicanora lives in Huepayan, Morelos with her husband. Niconara works hard managing her own convenience store. Nicanora and her husband have been saving to start building their home. This has been a long time dream and can finally have the opportunity to do so. Nicanora is asking for a loan to finish buying the materials needed for the first stage of building and start their home. Nicanora's husband is a farmer and given the informality of their jibs none of them can access credit through other institution or organization. With this first loan Nicanora and her husband will start the construction and the space needed so they can move in. Then they will little by little continue building. They will work on the construction and a certified technician will supervise the work to make sure that it meets the safety and quality standards. Nicanora looks forward to seeing a lifelong dream being accomplished.

loans.use: to start building her home

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en: Norberto lives in Hueyapan, Morelos. He has worked as a farmer most of his life. Norberto has build his home step by step. Now the final step is to add plaster to the walls. This will help Norberto deal with the cold winters and hot summers. Given his age and the informality of his business, he has no opportunity for credit from other institutions. Norberto has invested a lot of time and effort into his home renovations and he wishes to finish this work the right way. This is the opportunity he has to make the final addition. Norberto is thankful for this opportunity and wishes to complete his dream home.

loans.use: to finish the walls of the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Shallom Faith Group

texts.en:
Bertha is one the members of the Shallom faith group. She is a 42 year old lady, who is driven in her detergent making business. She stays in the Highfield area of Harare Suburbs with her four children and husband who is a self-employed electrician.
When she received training and a loan from Thrive, she decided to boost her business and restocked ingredients to produce more detergents and this enabled her to supply more orders as demand grew for her affordable products. She also improved her ways of doing business by better packaging and labeling her detergents. She is now supplying local tuck-shops and schools.
Since the detergent business has grown, Bertha wishes to intensify her cross border trading activities. She plans to buy a vehicle so that travelling will be made easier as she sells her detergents and clothes.

loans.use: To increase the range of her detergent making business & start cross-border sales

loans.name: Mothers With Vision Group

texts.en:
Lynett is a member of the Mothers With Vision Group, and is married to Lucky.  They live with their three children and one grandson. She has been running a chicken rearing business since year 2000 at her home with a fowl-run that has a carrying capacity of 200 birds. 
She is managing to sell 100 broilers every month, and this business is the main source of family livelihood.  In 2013, Lynett and her three friends managed to form a group called Mothers with a vision, and they received business management training and a loan amounting US$2400 from Thrive Microfinance.  With this she managed to boost her business up to the level of selling 100 birds per month. With her first loan she managed to get profits that allowed her to build a house into which she moved in from where she was renting. 
She is looking financial support of a loan of US$700 so that she may be able to do batches of 200 birds per cycle.

loans.use: To increase her poultry business to 200 birds per cycle

loans.name: Dynamic Group

texts.en:
Shelter is a happily married woman aged 42 and blessed with three children. She sells peanut butter, detergents and clothes. She has been in this business since 2000. She is a member of the Dynamic group. The income and savings they are currently making from their businesses are proving insufficient to fulfil their goals of achieving financial stability and improving the living standards for their families.The group started taking loans with Thrive Microfinance in 2012 and the ladies have proven to be reliable borrowers. Currently they are applying for a fifth loan and hope to improve their businesses.
A Kiva loan will help the Dynamic group to boost their businesses, Shelter will use her share of the loan to stock up on more items like dresses, jeans and shoes in order to increase variety and meet increasing demand. With a larger inventory, she will supply more customers and increase her revenue as well as improving their living standards.

loans.use: To stock up on more items like dresses, jeans & shoes for resale.

loans.name: Paida Group

texts.en:
Redundancy is a common occurrence in Zimbabwe where less than 15% of the working population is in formal employment and this number is in decline. So when Angela's husband lost his job, she stepped up and became not just a wife and mother to 2 children, but also the main breadwinner. 

Angela is a 33 years old and a member of Paida group based in Kuwadzana, Harare. She is a cross border trader and also does knitting seasonally as a business. Angela’s business has been her source of livelihood, as she pays rentals, school fees, buys food from the proceeds of her business. Angela has faced challenges of low profit margins because of high competition, but she knows that hard work and determination pays off and has been striving to succeed. 

With her loan from Thrive, Angela wants to grow her business thereby increasing her income levels. Angela plans to diversify to other business ventures so that when she faces challenges, she has another business to fall back on. She has identified vegetable farming as her next enterprise and she is preparing to start soon.

loans.use: To increase her cross-border activities and start vegetable farming.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase the range of foodstuffs that she sells and go on to open her own shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He works in USAID Access since the year 2011. Age 28 years; he is married and has one child. It is clear that Juan works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his child will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Juan is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jose Pablo

texts.en:
Jose Pablo lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (potatoes). Age 52 years; he is married. It is clear that Jose Pablo works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, improve the living conditions.
Jose Pablo is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Maziko Group

texts.en:
Modester is 45 years old, wearing yellow top in the front of the picture and is married. She has four children who go to school. Modester sells second-hand clothes, but to get extra income she also sells tomatoes. She does this business in order to provide the basic needs to her children and to financially support her family. She buys the products in the nearest city. 

Modester is applying for this loan in order to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. With the profits  she makes from her business, Modester plans to save money for buying a plot of land and to enlarge her business, plus she wants to pay school fees for her children. The loans she gets have helped her to increase her business and to adequately support her family.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.en:
Mariano de Jesus lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (Coffee and vegetables). Age 39 years; he is married and has three children. It is clear that Mariano de Jesus works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Mariano de Jesus is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Rosa Pascuala

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; la socia continua con su el negocio de venta de repuestos de segunda motorizados (carros y accesorios) la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la venta de comida solo los fines de semana, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de accesorios para carros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank "COMUZONE III". The bank is situated in the Cusco district, which belongs to the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Rosa continues with her business selling motorised second-hand spare parts (cars and accessories). She has been running this business for several years, and it is going well thanks to the effort which she puts into her business every day. She also sells food just at weekends. Rosa wishes to continue working to be able to continue supporting her family.

Rosa is asking for a loan to buy car spare parts. She feels grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Kissanga Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her late 30s, is divorced, with three children who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for one and a half years now.  She works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Salma's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase items in the food store and she has successfully paid back all her loans. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  

Salma will use this loan to increase her mamalishe stock and serve more customers. She dreams of building her own house.

Salma will share this loan with her loan group, Kissanga Group, which consists of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her mamalishe stock and serve more customers.

loans.name: Thắm

texts.en:
Mrs. Thắm operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Thắm is 37 years old, and she is married with one child. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thắm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Thắm hopes for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Glenda Rocio

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Glenda, tiene 28 años de edad está casada y de esa relación tienen dos  hijos de 10 y 7 años que estudian en escuela, su marido se dedica al comercio y agricultura.
Doña Glenda para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar hace varios años construyo una pequeña graja en la cual  se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos, ella compra los pollos y chanchos pequeños para luego alimentarlos y cuidarlos por tres meses los pollos y cinco los chanchos  tiempo necesario para que estén listos para la venta, entrega a los comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus animales y  también les vende a los vecinos del lugar.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los chanchos. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios adicionales que ofrece la institución como el seguro médico gratuito. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nuevos Horizontes de 24 de Mayo” (New Horizons of May 24) meets in the canton of May 24. This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and its hardworking people who engage in agriculture and raising animals.

Sra. Glenda lives in this place. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children (ages 10 and 7) who are in school. Her husband engages in trade and agriculture.

Doña Glenda helps her husband with the household expenses. Several years ago, they built a small stable for raising chickens and pigs. Glenda buy chickens and piglets and then feeds and cares for them. The chickens are kept for a period of three months and the pigs for five months before they are ready to be sold. She sells them to merchants who come to her house to buy the animals. Glenda also sells animals to her neighbors in the area.

This loan will be used to buy feed and medicines for her pigs. Glenda has been with the Communal Bank for two years and enjoys the additional services that the organization offers, such as free health insurance. Her dreams include providing the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Dollas

texts.en:
Dollas is 38 years. She is single and supports four children of 19, 16, 13, and 5 years.

Dollas is a farmer, a business she has done for the last four years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 30,000.

She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 15,000, which she will use to buy farm inputs like seeds for planting, fertilizer, as well as pay for her worker.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a good life, have a stable income, and cater for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz lives in Puebla with her uncle Jose Marcos and her daughter. Beatriz is a young single mother that has gone through several hardships but through hard work and dedication she has seen them through. Beatriz works by selling shoes and cosmetics through catalog. Beatriz is really excited because her uncle gave her a piece of land where she can build her house. She has been saving for the last couple of years and start doing some work. However she soon realized she needed technical assistance and advice. Beatriz has bought some material but still needs to buy more. She will start by building a room and a kitchen and then continue building slowly. Beatriz needs the loan to finish buying the materials needed. Due to the informality of her job and that she has no property under her name no other institution or organization will give her credit. She will receive technical training and supervision to make sure that the construction meets all the safety and quality measures. Beatriz is excited to move out of her uncle's home and start her own life.

loans.use: to buy materials to build her home

loans.name: Maria Fabiola

texts.es: A sus 42 años de edad Fabiola esta casada y tiene 6 hijos, su esposo se dedica al jornal, son 2 de sus hijos los que están estudiando, Fabiola vive en la campo con su familia  y las fuentes de ingresos es la crianza animales y los cultivos, el crédito o va  a invertir en la compra chanchos para seguir adelante con su negocio y de este negocio espera que sus ganancias le ayude para cubrir los gastos de educación vestido y alimentos de sus hijos.
texts.en: At 42 years of age Fabiola is married and has 6 children.  Her husband is a day laborer, and their two children are studying. Fabiola lives in a rural area with her family and her income mainly comes from raising animals and crops.  This loan will be used to invest in the purchase of pigs to grow and continue to grow her business.  With the profits from this business she hopes to cover the cost of school uniforms and food for their children.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
Santos lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (potatoes and coffee). Age 34 years; he is married and has three children. It is clear that Santos works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Santos is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married and lives with his wife and three children. He currently works for a telecommunications company. He describes his family as strong and hardworking. His father was diagnosed with a vision problem, and he has to change glasses constantly. Since his father is retired, he's currently supporting him financially. Due to economic reasons he was not able to have the surgery performed in the past. He is using this loan to pay for the eye surgery.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 48 years old, is married and she has two daughters.She helps her husband financially and support his father who is retired and takes care of her family. She is requesting this loan to help his father, since he has has developed vision problems and she decided to take him to get a vision exam. While in the eye exam, they found out he had an eye retina problem and an emergency procedure had to be performed.She is using this loan to pay the eye surgery.

loans.use: To Have an eye surgery

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela is a single mother that lives in San Martin, Puebla. She lives in her parents house and uses one room to cut hair of women and men of town and make some money. Estela now has a piece of land and wishes to start building. She has an amount saved but is requesting a loan to finish buying materials needed for the first stage of construction of her new home. Estela is looking forward to giving her family a space where they can grow and play and leave her parents house. Given that Estela does not have a formal job, she has no access to credit form other institution or organizations. Estela will receive technical training and supervision to ensure that the work done complies with safety and quality standards. Estela looks forward to start building her dreams.

loans.use: to start building her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Zvaita Ishe Group

texts.en:
Hardworking, dedicated and innovative—these are the qualities of Sipiwe, a fighter who has dedicated a large part of her life to taking care of her children.

Sipiwe is a member of Zvaita Ishe group based in Crowborough High Density Suburb in Harare. She is a widowed mother of four school going children. Sipiwe is a cross border trader who sells clothing, shoes and other accessories at a flea market. She has been doing this business for the last five years.

Sipiwe and her group members decided to improve their business and increase their sales. It is for this reason, that they requested loans from Thrive Microfinance to make some improvements to their businesses. Her Kiva loan will enable Sipiwe her to make her business thrive so that she will have enough money to continue to support her family and her business. In Future Sipiwe is planning to acquire another flea market stand and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.en: Maria Ines lives in San Martin, Puebla and sells veterinary products. She buys the products from big warehouses in the city of Puebla and sells them as retail in her town. Maria Ines has been saving for the last couple of years to build her home, she is now asking for a loan to finish buying the materials needed for the first phase of construction. Maria Ines is excited to start building her home the right way. She knows that she will need to work hard to accomplish it, but also knows that it will be an investment for life and something she can leave behind for her family. Due to her age and the informality of her job Maria Ines has no access to credit from other institutions. Maria Ines is excited to finally accomplish her life long dream.

loans.use: to start building her home

loans.name: Lucrecia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lucrecia es una señora que tiene una relacion estable donde han procreado un hijo lo cual lo tienen a su cargo, y se desmpeña como maestra de educacion primaria desde hace 20 años de loborar y su conyugue se desempeña como conductor en una empresa en el departamento donde habitan con su familia.
 Actualmente esta señora se acerco a la oficina de ceprodel par solicitar el cuarto financiamiento el cual lo utilizaria para hacer un corredor a su cas de habitacion  y lo invertiria en la compra de materilaes de construccion  1000 ladrillos, perlines, hierro, cemento, piedrin, arena y pago de mano de obra y de esa manera tener mejores condicones y nivel de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is a woman who has a stable relationship where they have one son who is in her care. She has worked as a primary school teacher for 20 years, and her spouse works as a driver for a business in the area where they live with their family.    

Recently, Lucrecia visited the Ceprodel office to request her fourth loan, which she would use to build a corridor to her house and would invest in the purchase of building materials including 1,000 bricks, metal beams, iron, cement, gravel, sand and manual labor – to thus have better conditions and living standards at home.

loans.use: to buy building materials – 1,000 bricks, metal beams, iron, cement, gravel and sand – and manual labor.

loans.name: Fátima María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.
Aquí vive la señora Fátima, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 13 y 11 años, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su marido es chofer.
Doña Fátima es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para conseguir sus recursos y así ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  ella sale cuatro días a la semana y no tiene horario fijo, también vende en su casa a clientes más conocidos, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 8 años con esta actividad con la cual sale adelante junto a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, entre otras prendas ya que se viene la época cuando más ventas tiene. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe de los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The community bank Los Corrales meets every 15 days in a community called Los Corrales. It is a few minutes from the city of Montecristi, which is a city with a rich prehistoric culture. In this place, the majority of the residents work in different fields like artisan crafts and general commerce. 

Fátima lives here. She is 36 years old, married, and has three children, who are 15, 13, and 11 years old, from this relationship. Her two older children study in the high school and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband is a driver. Fátima is a woman who likes to work to obtain more resources and help her husband with household expenses. She works in commerce, selling all types of clothing door-to-door. She works 4 days per week and doesn't have a fixed schedule. She also sells to frequent clients from her home. They buy on credit and she collects payment every 8 days. She has done this for 8 years and it has helped her family get ahead. 

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other garments since most of her sales are in this part of the year. She has been in the community bank for 6 years and she likes it because it helps her get loans. Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other garments.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena lives in San Martin, Puebla and is the mother of two children. Lorena manages a family owned convenience store. She works hard every day so that she can give her family what they need. Lorena has a piece of land neighboring her parents home and wishes to start building a home for her family. She has saved for the last year and is asking for a credit to buy the materials needed to start with the foundations of the home. Lorena has no access to credit from local institutions due to the informality of her job and because the land is under her parents name. Lorena will receive technical training and supervision to make sure that the construction meets all quality and safety standards. Lorena wishes to give her family what she never had, their own home.

loans.use: to start building the foundation of a home for her family

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en: Luis Alberto lives in San Martin, Puebla with his parents. Luis Alberto works by renting his family's harvest machinery. The machinery used to be his father's, but Luis Alberto has managed to save from previous jobs and bought it from his father. Luis Alberto also works the field when he is not managing the rental business. Luis Alberto was recently given permission to build on his family's land. He is really excited to start building his house and soon a family. He has a longterm girlfriend and wishes to propose once they have their own place to live. Luis Alberto has saved some money for the construction but still needs a loan to finish buying the materials. Given the informality of his job and that the land is not under his name, he has no access to credit from other institutions or organizations. Luis Alberto will receive technical training and supervision to make sure his work meets all the safety and quality standards. Luis Alberto wishes to complete what will be the first step to his new future.

loans.use: to start building his home

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 28-year-old married mother of five children who started four years ago selling cosmetics and make up from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.  She tutors to increase her income and provide her family with a better life. 

She is a hard worker and a sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to satisfy her family. Her husband has a seasonal job, working as a builder with limited income. 

Today, Fatima is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to help her husband in buying an espresso machine as a second daily source of income.

Fatima hopes to open her own accessories shop in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to help her husband in buying an espresso machine as a second daily source of income.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en casa propia en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, sus pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a la venta de harina de maíz y chicha de jora (bebida típica de la región), su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de material de construcción como ladrillo, piedra, fierro, entre otros, para realizar mejoras en su vivienda. Con esto Maria espera mejorar la condición de su casa, logrando así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 and lives with her life partner and their four children in their own house in the La Matanza district which lies in the Morropon province of the Piura region in northern coastal Peru. 

Life is peaceful in this area: it's inhabitants mainly work in agriculture, livestock farming and breeding animals.

Maria makes a living selling maize flour, corn beer (a typical drink of the region). She runs her business from home. She has more than 5 years' of experience running her business and has very good personal and work references. 

She will use the loan to buy construction material like bricks, stones, iron and other things to make some improvements to her house. By doing this she hopes to improve her house and, in turn, manage to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction material like bricks, stone, iron and other things to make some improvements to her house.

loans.name: Los Tigrillos Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Tigrillo lo integran tres socios exitosos en su vida laboral, quien lo coordina es la señora María Daysi de 59 años de edad, acompañada, comerciante de frutas en el centro turístico volcán Masaya y en el departamento desde hace veinte años, es el primer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento en ADIM e invertirá en cosecha de tamarindo, ya que es el mayor demanda tiene en esta temporada. El resto de los integrantes son, el señor Eliezer quien tiene la edad de 35 años su negocio es enderezado y pintura desde hace dieciséis años, y la señora Lucía de 27 años de edad quien realiza hecha y venta de tortilla desde hace un año en su domicilio.
texts.en: The united group Tigrillo is made up of three members who have been successful in their work. 59-year-old María Daysi is the coordinator. She is married. She sells fruit in volcán Masaya and the department for 20 years. This is the first time that she has applied for a loan from ADIM. She will use it to buy tamarinds, since they have high demand during this part of the year. The other members are 35-year-old Eliezer whose has done body work and painted cars for 16 years and 27-year-old Lucia who has made and sold tortillas from her home for a year.

loans.use: to buy tamarinds.

loans.name: Geoconda Anabell

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Geoconda, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, uno mayor de edad y dos de 17 y 16 años de edad, todos estudian el mayor en universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo se es técnico electricista.
Doña Geoconda es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para varias actividades, para ella  que vende ropa de todo tipo y para que su marido la utilice en su trabajo, el realiza arreglos a artefactos electrónicos y vehículos y  requiere del crédito para comprar repuestos, en la actualidad está arreglando un carro que compro y espera venderlo para ganar algo en esta transacción. Así ellos se ganan el sustento diario de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar repuestos para autos y ropa de todo tipo para sus ventas. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nuevos Horizontes de 24 de Mayo” (New Horizons of May 24) meets in the canton of May 24. This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and its hardworking people who engage in agriculture and raising animals.

Sra. Geoconda lives in this place. She is 44 years old, married, and has three children. One child is an adult and the other two are ages 17 and 16. All of her children are studying – the oldest attends a university and the two younger ones are in high school. Her husband is an electronics technician.

Doña Geoconda is a good wife who will use her loan for various activities. For her, she will sell clothes of all types while her husband will use some of the loan for his work. He repairs household appliances and vehicles, but he needs the loan to buy spare parts. He is currently repairing a car that he purchased and hopes to sell it for some profit from the transaction. Both of them provide for the daily needs of their family.

This loan will used to buy automobile spare parts and clothing of all types that she can sell. Geoconda has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because of the help the loans have provided. Her dreams include seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothing of all types that she can sell and spare parts for her husband's business.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 57 year old married woman and a mother of five grown up children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a sari-sari store selling various goods and food items to the people in her place. Leila has been in the business for more than 10 years now.

Leila is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like rice, eggs, canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, condiments, bread and snack foods. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers to her store.

In the future, Leila has hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for reinvestment into the same business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell like rice, eggs, canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries. condiments, bread and snack foods.

loans.name: Sarra

texts.en:
Sarra is 38 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

Sarra works very hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, she has been selling personal products in the Philippines. Currently, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, including body lotion and perfume.

Sarra would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, including body lotion and perfume

loans.name: Katerine Johana

texts.es: Katerine,  es una mujer emprendedora de 32 años de edad,residente en un barrio de Barranquilla, se encuentra dedicada a la venta de ropa, calzado y cosméticos desde el año 2010, su idea de negocio surgió por la necesidad de generar ingresos para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ella es madre de una niña de 5 años y un niño de 13 años,  a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación y bienestar.  Ella labora todos los días en el horario de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m., y ofrece sus productos a sus amigos, vecinos, familiares y referidos, vende a crédito y pacta con el cliente las fechas y cuotas de pago.  Sus compras las realiza a distribuidoras mayoristas de Barranquilla y cancela de contado. Diciembre es una temporada propicia para vender los productos que katerine comercializa, ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará ropa para dama, caballeros y niños, calzado y cosméticos.  Esta inversión la beneficiará, ya que podrá responder a la demanda de sus clientes de forma inmediata, mejorará su surtido y las posibilidades de mayores utilidades.  Katerine tiene grandes desafíos en su negocio para alcanzar su meta, ella necesita captar mas clientes y fidelizarlos, su estrategia es ofrecer precios asequibles, excelente servicio y productos de calidad. Su meta familiar es remodelar su vivienda a largo plazo.
texts.en: Katerine is an enterprising woman of 32 who lives in a neighborhood of Barranquilla.  She has sold clothing, shoes, and cosmetics for a living since 2010; her idea for this business came out of her need to generate income to be able to cover her household expenses.  She is the mother a five-year-old girl and a 13-year-old boy to whom she wants to offer a good education and wellbeing.  She works every day from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and she offers her products to her friends, neighbors, relatives, and references; she sells on credit and agrees with her customers on the dates and amounts of payments.  She does her buying from wholesale distributors in Barranquilla and she pays cash.  December is a great time to sell the products Katerine deals in; she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy women's, men's and children's clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.  This investment will benefit her as she will be able to meet her customers' demands immediately; she will improve her selection and the possibility of greater benefits.  Katerine faces great challenges in her business to achieve her goal; she needs to attract more customers and make them loyal; her strategy is to offer reasonable prices, excellent service, and quality products.  Her longterm goal is to remodel her home.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's, and children's clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hernan Ismael

texts.es:
