loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 46 years old and has nine children. She is married and has five children who are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets and feeds for her business.

Mercedita has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds for her business

loans.name: Elisida

texts.es:
Elisida tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Elisida se dedica a la venta de soya, desde hace 4 años, su negocio lo ofrece en una mototaxi por todo el distrito y alrededores; ella solicita préstamo para activo fijo; pues desea invertir en la construcción de su cocina compra de adobe y cemento para poder mejorar el ambiente donde prepara su soya, esto le permitirá tener mayor comodidad y mejorar la calidad de su producto por lo que podrá venderlo a un mejor precios y esto a su vez le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elisida, 28, lives with her partner and has a child in her care.  She lives in her own home in a rural area of the district of Oyotún in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The people there work mainly in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

Elisida has earned a living for four years selling soy milk.  She's requesting the loan for fixed assets because she wants to invest in building a kitchen.  She's buying adobe and cement to improve the environment where she makes her soy milk.

This will allow her to have more conveniences and improve the quality of her product.  She'll be able to sell it at a better price and, in the short term, she'll improve her income, increase her profits, and improve her family's quality of life as a result.

loans.use: to invest in building a kitchen for preparing her soy milk

loans.name: Alex Adan

texts.es:
El señor  Alex  de 39  años  de edad es soltero  vive, en su propia  casa  no tiene hijos que dependen de él, se dedica desde hace  10 años al negocio de venta de ropa americana y zapatos, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que le conocen.
Don Alex  es una persona trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras también vende productos de la canasta básica.
Don Alex  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de más productos para su negocio como ser: pantalones, vestidos, camisas, zapatos, tenis, blusas, etc.  Desea aprovechar la época de navidad para hacer negocios. Este contento por el apoyo de Prisma a su negocio es su séptimo préstamo que solicita.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014
texts.en:
Alex, 39, is single and lives in his own home.  He has no dependent children.  He has worked for 10 years in his business selling clothing from the United States and shoes.  His customers are his friends and acquaintances.

Alex is a hardworking person who wants to get ahead.  He lives in a community in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.  He also sells basic staple products.

Alex is requesting the loan to buy more products for his business: pants, dresses, shirts, shoes, sneakers, blouses, and so on.  He wants to make the most of the Christmas season to conduct business.  This is the seventh loan he has requested.

He's happy about Prisma's support of his business.  His dream is to improve his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, November 2014

loans.use: to buy pants, dresses, shirts, shoes, sneakers, blouses, etc. for his other business

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en:
Leonilo is 60 years old and single.

Leonilo runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as shampoo, canned goods, beer, soft drinks, noodles, etc. to sell.

He has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, beer, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

In the future, Leonilo would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as shampoo, canned goods, beer, soft drinks, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalie is 39 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Rosalie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosalie has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Julian Esteban

texts.es:
Julián es un joven de 20 años de edad, con deseos y anhelos de poder estudiar, formarse en áreas administrativas y en un futuro ser administrador de empresas, como es un persona que nació en un humilde hogar, ni él ni su familia tienen el capital para pagar su estudios, es por esta razón que a través de un crédito quiere iniciar su propia empresas, para ayudar en su casa y pagarse su educación.
Su idea de negocio es comprar una moto para transportar personas, una actividad muy común en las veredas puesto que por ciertos lugares no pasan carros y los que pasan solo van si estas totalmente llenos y por ello son tan famosas y requeridas las motocicletas. 
Con este crédito ayudaras a un joven que busca formarse y buscar un mejor futuro para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Julian is a young man who is 20 years old, with wishes and dreams of being able to study, to prepare himself in the field of administration, and in the future be a business manager in a company. Since he was born in a modest home, neither he nor his family have the resources to pay for his studies. It is for this reason that, through a loan, he wants to start his own company, to help out in his home and pay for his education. 
His business idea is to buy a motorcycle to transport passengers, a common occupation in the trails, because through certain parts, cars do not go through, and those that do only go if they are completely full. This is why motorcycles are so famous and in demand. 
With this loan, you will help a young man who aspires to educate himself and look for a better future for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to start a passenger transportation business.

loans.name: Doña Alicia Ahorros (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo "Doña Alicia" está ubicado en una comunidad mazahua, para llegar a ella solo hay un autobús que cubre la ruta tres veces al día, las personas de la comunidad deben estar muy atentas al horario del autobús si necesitan viajar al municipio.

Doña Alicia quien es la representante, tiene 35 años de edad, es una mujer muy amable pero sobre todo muy platicadora, muy extrovertida. Está casada desde hace 17 años con el señor Rogelio y juntos han conformado una familia con cinco hijos de los cuales, dos aún estudian su educación primaria.

Don Rogelio se dedica a manejar un taxi desde hace tres años; inició en un automóvil sin permiso para transitar libremente como prestador de este servicio lo que le causaba muchos problemas con otros taxistas. Don Rogelio anhelaba tener un vehículo con placas y autorización para trabajar porque realmente es un buen negocio, así que se acercó al gobierno para solicitar el apoyo y a pesar de que el trámite fue largo, finalmente puede logró lo que quería.

Durante los fines de semana, Don Rogelio tiene muy buenas ganancias, aunque se enfrenta al constante aumento de la gasolina. Hay días en los que el ingreso no es el esperado, pero entonces sabe que puede contar con el apoyo de su mujer quien cría pollos, pavos y elabora artesanías bordadas para poner en venta y tener un ingreso extra para solventar los  gastos del hogar y educación.  Es así que en equipo trabajan para hacer realidad su más grande sueño que es poder ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente.

Con el nuevo préstamo que están solicitando Don Don Rogelio dará mantenimiento al taxi y comprará dos llantas mientras que Doña Alicia invertirá en sus animales y artesanías. Doña Alicia se muestra muy agradecida con VisionFund y KIVA por la oportunidad de obtener un préstamo porque así podrán invertir en el taxi que es su herramienta de trabajo fundamental.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Elvira, quien inviertirá en lámparas y figuras de yeso; Doña Carmen, Catalina y Rosalba quienes invertirán en la cría de borregos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Doña Alicia, quien viste un suéter negro. Además se puede ver el taxi de su esposo y algunas figurillas de yeso de Doña Elvira.
texts.en:
The "Doña Alicia" Group is located in the Mazahua district.  To get there, there is only one bus serving the route three times a day.  People in the community must be very attentive to the bus schedule if they need to travel to town.  Doña Alicia who is the representative of the group, is 35 years old.  She is very kind but above all a very talkative, very outgoing woman.  She has been married for 17 years to Rogelio and together they have formed a family with five children, of which two are still studying primary education. Rogelio has been driving a taxi for the past three years.

He started in a car without taxi permits to move freely as a provider of this service which caused him many problems with other drivers. Rogelio longed for a vehicle with plates and authorization to work because it really is a good occupation.  He approached the government to request support and although the process was long, he finally got what he wanted. During the weekends, Rogelio has very good earnings, although he faces the constant increases in the price of gasoline. There are days that income is not as expected, but then he knows he can count on the support of his wife who raises chickens, turkeys and makes embroidery to sell and earn extra income to cover the costs of home crafts and education.

Thus, with team work they hope to realize their biggest dream which is to see their children achieve professional jobs. With the new loan they are requesting, Rogelio will maintain the taxi and buy two tires while Alicia will invest in their animals and crafts.  Alicia is very grateful to VisionFund and KIVA for the opportunity to get a loan because with it, they may invest in the taxi that is their fundamental working tool.

The other members of the group are Elvira, who makes lamps and plaster figures; Carmen, Catalina and Rosalba who raise sheep.

* The photograph was taken in the house of Alicia, who wears a black sweater. Also, you can see her husband's cab and some plaster figurines made by  Elvira.

loans.use: to provide taxi service and buy two tires.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Crusenia

texts.es:
Crusenia tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil divorciada, vive en casa de familiares junto a sus padres y su hijo en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicios agrícolas y a la crianza y venta de carneros. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de carneros para su negocio, con esto Crusenia busca mejorar la productividad de estos y aumentar su nivel de ingresos, así como también su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Crusenia, 30, is divorced.  She lives with her parents and her son in the home of some relatives in the Zaña district of the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  She lives in a community devoted to commerce, agriculture, and ranching.

She earns a living providing agricultural services as well as raising and selling sheep.  She has experience in the business and very good personal and work references in her district.

She'll use the loan to buy a large number of sheep for her business.

Crusenia plans to improve the productivity of her sheep with this loan and improve her income as well as her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a large number of sheep for her business

loans.name: Emilicar

texts.en:
Emilicar is 49 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Emilicar has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Emilicar would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wild cane leaves to make her handcrafted work

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 54-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a coffee plantation alongside selling produce to supplement his income. He started this business to generate funds to meet family needs. He hopes to buy a motorcycle to assist him in transporting his products to the customers. However, his main challenges are inadequate capital and price fluctuations.

He is asking for a loan to buy farm inputs like mulch and fertilizer to improve the coffee plantation.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like mulch and fertilizers to improve the coffee plantation.  .

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera belongs to Lahore. She is 29 and blessed with a child. She is a dedicated housewife. Her husband drives a rickshaw to earn a living. His daily income is not substantial. Now that they have a child, they have to plan to his future as well. 

The rickshaw that he drives has worn out and he needs to make some repairs for which he is short of cash. For this purpose, Sumera has requested a loan to help repair the rickshaw. They are pleased and thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Ricardo Ernesto

texts.es: Ricardo es un hombre de 21 años de edad que se desempeña como vendedor de artículos varios, actividad que realiza desde hace 1 año de forma ambulante. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ricardo sabe que se acerca una época de mucha expectativa, ya que en navidad las ventas se incrementan, por lo que él ha pensado en solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: sandalias, toallas, zapatos, etc. Para surtir su mercadería y así tener más productos para ofrecer a su clientes esperando de esta manera aprovechar la temporada navideña que se aproxima.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a 21-year-old man who works as a merchant. He has been selling various merchandise for one year and conducts his sales as a traveling vendor. Ricardo lives in his own home along with his family. He looks forward to the upcoming season with great expectation since sales increase around Christmas. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that he can invest in sandals, towels, shoes, and other products.

By stocking his inventory of merchandise, he will have more products to offer to his customers. In this manner, he hopes to take advantage of the Christmas season that is approaching.

loans.use: to buy sandals, towels, shoes, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Jeanalyn

texts.en:
Jeanalyn is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school, Jeanalyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Jeanalyn runs a buy and sell of fruits business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fruits to sell like apples, oranges, bananas, etc.

Jeanalyn has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell like apples, oranges, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 41-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a retail shop alongside farming to earn him an extra income. He started this business to educate his children. He hopes to expand his business to a wholesale shop, however his main challenge is competition from other traders.
 
Moses is requesting a loan to buy more stock like crates of soda, soap, salt and general merchandize to add in his shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock like crates of soda, soap, salt and general merchandize to add to his shop.

loans.name: Manita De Ángel Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo “Manita de Ángel” son muy trabajadores y amables, se conocen desde hace muchos años por lo que los une también su amistad. El nombre lo eligieron porque en la casa de la representante donde se reúnen, hay una planta llamada de esta manera que cuelga en una parte de la casa otorgando una vista muy agradable.

Doña Irene es precisamente la dueña de la planta, ella tiene 49 años de edad y está casada desde hace 32 con el señor Epifanio, juntos han formado una familia con ocho hijos de los cuales tres aún dependen de ellos y se encuentran estudiando.

Desde hace 20 años Doña Irene y Don Epifanio han vendido artículos de mercería. Epifanio compra y vende los productos en la capital del país donde pasa la mayor parte del tiempo y sólo regresa los fines de semana a su comunidad para estar al lado de su familia. Mientras tanto, Doña Irene cuida a sus hijos y al llegar las vacaciones de la escuela ella acompaña a su esposo para ayudarle en el negocio. 

La pareja decidió iniciar la actividad por la falta de un empleo aunque las ganancias no eran extraordinarias, les ayudaban a solventar los gastos. Actualmente ya cuentan con un puesto fijo y más seguro aunque su gran reto siempre ha sido tener el dinero suficiente para invertir en más mercancía. Por lo anterior han recurrido a los préstamos de VisionFund. Siempre que reciben el dinero tratan de comprar lo que más les hace falta, esta vez necesitan más hilos, cortaúñas, peines, agujas, cepillos, moños, pasadores, etc. 

Ya son 8 años desde que Irene solicitó su primer préstamo a la institución y está muy agradecida porque gracias al apoyo pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos mayores aunque ahora su sueño es que los tres que aún viven con ella puedan terminar una carrera profesional.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Doña Celedonia y Aurora quienes invertirán en la venta de jarcería y plásticos; Leonor, en ropa; Edgar, en almohadads y Araceli, en artículos de bisutería.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras debajo del quiosco del municipio. Doña Irene viste un suéter blanco y es la primera que aparece a mano derecha*
texts.en:
Members of the "Manita Angel" group are hardworking and kind.  They have known each other for many years and so also are bound by friendship. The name was chosen because in the house where they meet, there is a plant by this name hanging on a part of the house giving a nice view.

Irene is the caretaker of the plant.  She is 49 years old and has been married for 32 years to Epifanio.  Together have formed a family with eight children, three of whom still depend on them and are studying.

For the past 20 years, Irene and Epifanio sold haberdashery.  Epifanio buys and sells products in the capital where he spends most of the time and only comes back on weekends to their community to be next to his family. Meanwhile, Irene takes care of their children and during the school holidays, she accompanies her husband to help in the business.

The couple decided to start the business because of the lack of a jobs event though the income was not extraordinary.  It helped them to cover their expenses.  Currently, they already have a fixed location with more security but the greatest challenge has always been to have enough money to invest in more merchandise. Therefore they have requested loans VisionFund.  With the funds they have received, they try to buy what they need the most. This time, they need more wire, nail clippers, combs, needles, brushes, ribbons, pins, etc.

It has already been eight years since Irene requested the first loan to from institution and is very grateful and gives thanks for the support so that she could raise her older children but now her dream is that all three still living at home will have a career.

The other members of the group are Aurora Celandine and who business is in selling containers and plastics; Leonor, clothes; Edgar, rugs; and Araceli, in imitation jewelery.

* The photograph was taken on the stairs below the kiosk of the municipality. Irene wears a white sweater and is the first to appear on the right hand *

loans.use: to buy products for re-sale.

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Dara

texts.en: Dara is a 21-year-old single nursing student at a university in a city. He is a son of a farmer family from Tbomg Khmum province in Cambodia. Because of a lack of finances, he would like to secure a loan to pay his tuition fees for three years. This loan will help him graduate successfully and have a chance to build his future. After graduation, he is going to run a pharmacy and then he will be able to save money to build a house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 32 years old and a resident of Carles, Iloilo. She is married with three children ages three, four and six. Rosie's husband is a fisherman. She is dependent on his catch to sell to earn a living. Rosie helps in preparing his tools for fishing. She is asking for a loan to buy floaters, nylon, fishing nets, rope and fishing weights. Rosie hope to reinvest more in her business so that her family can live in comfort.

Any income will be used to pay for school, buy a healthy diet and for savings.

loans.use: to buy floaters, nylon, fishing nets, rope and fishing weights

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more raw materials like textiles and yarns for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia  continua  con su negocio de restaurant ,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,la socia a la vez continua vendiendo salchipapas ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, aceite, carnes entre otros.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage her restaurant business. She has been in this business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. At the same time, she continues to sell “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes). The borrower wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy supplies such as rice, oil, meat, and other items. The borrower appreciates the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, meat, and other supplies.

loans.name: Teodorica

texts.en:
Teodorica is 59 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Teodorica is borrowing PHP 13,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teodorica has been in pig fattening for eight years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 31 years old. She is married to Francis and together they have been blessed with two children who are eight and four years old.

Monica runs a soft drinks business, which she has done for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Monica has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000, which she will use to add stock of sodas, fruit juices, squashes and mineral water, which are vital as we near the Christmas season.

Monica's hope and dream for the future is to be prosperous.

loans.use: to add stock of sodas, fruit juices and mineral water

loans.name: Sunleang

texts.en: Sunleang(55) live with his wife on a floating village along Tonle SapLake  in Cambodia. He and his wife are Farmer and Fisher. They can fish all seasons and in dry season they grow crops and farm rice. They have four children. They would like to own a solar system to save money on their energy costs.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system

location.town: Koh Tamov Village, Kampong Preahkorki Commune, Bor

loans.name: Diana Ester

texts.es: Diana de 28 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida ella se dedica a la venta de ropa pada damas y caballeros desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y ai poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Diana is 28 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion. She has been selling women’s and men’s clothes for several years. Her business is located in a very busy area and she has many customers.

Diana is requesting a loan so that she can buy more clothes in bulk. This will enable her to continue her sales and generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Iloilo, Philippines. She is engaged in retail sales of clothes. This has been the source of her income for more than three years now. Ana Marie is standing next to a package of clothes to sell. 

Ana Marie is asking for a loan to buy more clothes to sell to her customers. With a loan, she will be able to augment her stocks thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

In the future, Ana Marie hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: Dan, who is a single man living in Kamwenge, Uganda, used his previous loan to buy more clothes to sell. He managed to use the proceeds to start a mini-supermarket as his main source of income. He started this business to have better a standard of living. He hopes to expand his business to a bigger well-known supermarket. He faces the challenge of price fluctuation. He intends to use the loan to buy more items like Blue band, cosmetics and drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items like Blue band, cosmetics and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Babelyn

texts.en:
Babelyn is 30 years old and has two children. Babelyn is married and one of her children is currently in school.

Babelyn is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Babelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Babelyn has been in pig fattening for six years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Babelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Edilma Ernestina

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Edilma, tiene 49 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 10 hijos, 8 mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 15  años, uno de ellos estudia  en colegio. El marido es albañil. 
Doña Edilma tiene una tienda de víveres en casa, vende productos de primera necesidad, colas y helados, tiene su tienda muy bien surtida para que sus clientes encuentren todo lo que necesitan, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 a 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde,  Tiene más de 3 años su tienda.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito pues es su forma de salir adelante, con sus ganancias pudo solventar los gastos que ocasiono una operación que le hicieron a uno de sus hijos. Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar  arroz, azúcar, embutidos, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad  para surtir más su tienda. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 2 años y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son aumentar su tienda.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nuevos Horizontes de 24 de Mayo” (New Horizons of May 24) meets in the canton of May 24. This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and its hardworking people who engage in agriculture and raising animals.

Sra. Edilma lives in this place. She is 49 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has 10 children. Eight of her children are grown and the two youngest are ages 16 and 15. One child is in high school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Doña Edilma has a provisions store in her home where she sells basic necessity products, soft drinks, and ice cream. Her store is well-stocked so that her customers can find everything they need. Edilma works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. and sometimes much later. She has had her store for more than three years.

Edilma is requesting another loan so that she can get ahead. With her earnings, she will be able to cover expenses that she incurs, such as paying for an operation for one of her children. This loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, sausages, detergents, and other basic necessity products so that she can restock her store. Edilma has been with the Communal Bank for two years and enjoys the help that the organization has provided. Her dreams include expanding her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, sausages, detergents, and other basic necessity products.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 42-year-old divorced mother of five children who has worked as a hairdresser for 14 years to cover the needs and expenses of her family for she is their sole earner.

Zeina is a hard worker and her family is her priority. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to legally register her house. She hopes to open her own beauty salon in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to legally register her house

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic household commodities like vinegar, sugar, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, soap and seasonings. She is a 35-year-old married woman with a 15-year-old son. She has been engaged in this kind of business for five years now. In addition to that, she also raises and sells hogs.

Marlene is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy assorted groceries for the store and have additional capital for her food vending business. This will help Marlene and her family fill her store with various stocks that could attract more buyers to come and purchase. In the coming months, she will start to open up a food vending business to help augment her daily income. She will be able to pay her loan and continue to send her child to school.

In the future, Marlene dreams of expanding her business to become sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries for the store and have additional capital for her food vending business

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aiza is 25 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Aiza has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Aiza has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Aiza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 60 years old and married with four children.  

Lolita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Lolita has been raising pigs for 13 years now and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosie is 33 years old and both of her children are in school.

Rosie has a broom-making business in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Rosie has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 42 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Jocelyn has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream vending business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream vending business

loans.name: Wilbroad

texts.en:
Wilbroad, who deals in cattle fattening, is married. He used his previous loan to buy more cattle for fattening. His main business is fattening cattle alongside farming, where he earns a living. He started this business to increase his income and look after his family. He hopes to increase the number of his cows and expand his farm. He faces the challenge of competition from other farmers.
 
Wilbroad is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia belongs to Lahore. She is 34 and blessed with four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transportation services in Lahore. He is the sole earning person in his family. Due to constant driving, some of the rickshaw parts have worn out and need repair and replacement. Due to his low income, he is unable to save. Thus, he doesn't have the financing for repairing his rickshaw. Sonia has therefore requested a loan to help her husband repair his rickshaw. 

They are pleased and thankful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Socorro De Los Santos

texts.es:
La señora Socorro de los Santos,es madre soltera de cinco hijos de los cuales solo dos estan bajo su responsabilidad, labora como enfermera en uno de los centros hospitalarios en la Ciudad de León desde hace treinta y seis años, inicia sus labores en turnos rotativos, ella realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Doña Socorro, solicito este crédito a Ceprodel para la compra de bloques, cemento, arena y hierro, dichos materiales fueron implementados en la reparación de su humilde vivienda brindándole mayor confort y una mejor calidad de vida para ella al igual que a su familia
texts.en:
Sra. Socorro de Los Santos is a single mother of five children, but only two of them are still under her responsibility. She has been working as a nurse at one of the central hospitals in the city of León for 36 years. Her work is done in rotating shifts and she performs this job in order to sustain her household.

Doña Socorro is requesting this loan from CEPRODEL in order to buy blocks, cement, sand, and iron. These materials will be used to repair her modest home so that she can provide greater comfort and a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, and iron so that she can repair her home.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 43 years old and married with three children. With two of her children currently in school, Merlina works very hard to provide for them.

Merlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Merlina has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, cereals, coffee, tissue paper, juice, soft drinks, sugar, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Merlina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Hilda Amparo

texts.es:
La señora  Hilda  de 40  años de edad,  tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su esposo en su casa propia,  ubicada en la comunidad de la cuesta, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de tortillas.
Doña Hilda su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa y ahí llegan los clientes a comprarle las tortillas y también vende nacatamales de gallina y de cerdo.
Doña Hilda  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña y cal.es su segundo crédito que solicita a Prisma, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su familia.
Doña Hilda  uno de sus sueños es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda is 40 years old and has two dependent children. She and her husband live in their own home, which is located in the community of La Cuesta in southern Honduras. Hilda has been in the business of selling tortillas for five years.

Doña Hilda’s business is located at her house and her customers go there to buy tortillas. She also sells tamales that are wrapped in banana leaves and made with chicken and pork. Doña Hilda is requesting a loan in order to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder. This is the second loan that she has requested from Prisma. She hopes that this investment will enable her family to get ahead.

One of her dreams is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder for her business.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Casa Huerta Group

texts.es: El grupo “EMPRENDEDORAS DE CASA HUERTA” está conformada por socios que prestan servicios de costura y servicios de albañilería y al comercio minorista. Derly tiene 31 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos educando. Ella implemento su librería en su vivienda hace unos años por motivación de su hermana y lo fue implementando día a día ofreciendo sus productos a colegios. Hoy en día su librería le genera ganancias que le permite darles una buena calidad de vida a sus 02 hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de adornos navideños juguetes ropas para niños por campaña navideña. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Derly es la primera persona sentada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
The group “Emprendedoras de Casa Huerta” includes members who sew, provide bricklaying services, and engage in small trade.

Derly is 31 years old, single, and has two children in school. She has a bookstore in her home that she started a few years ago after she received encouragement from her sister. Every day she offers products to schools. Today her bookstore generates income that allows her to provide a better quality of life for her two children. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of Christmas toys and children’s clothing for the holiday season.

The group appreciates the Kiva lenders for providing this loan. In the photo, Derly is the first person seated on the left.

loans.use: to buy Christmas toys and children's clothing.

loans.name: Hugo Cesar

texts.es:
Hugo Cesar tiene 30 años, de estado civil conviviente. Su familia es unida, vive con su cónyuge y sus 02 hijas en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Este distrito es habitado por gente amable y trabajadora dedicada principalmente al comercio, ganadería y a la agricultura.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de carneros, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a prestar servicios como peón agrícola en su distrito y pueblos cercanos. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de carneros para su negocio así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Hugo Cesar espera aumentar la productividad de su negocio, mejorando así su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hugo Cesar is a 30-year old man who lives with his wife and 2 daughters in their house at the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, north coast of Perú. People in this district is nice and hard-working, and they mainly work in trade, stock breeding and agriculture. He works in stock breeding and sale of rams, and has over 10 years of experience in the business with very good personal y professional references in the area. He also offers his services as farm workman in his district and villages nearby. 

The loan will be used to buy more rams for the business as well as balanced food to feed them. Hugo Cesar expects to increase his business' productivity, improving his income level and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more rams for his business as well as balanced food to feed them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, bags, lime powder, and other supplies for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS FLORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Veronica ella es soltera y tiene 30 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite,galletas y arroz.
 La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

La socia que esta tapado con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal Las Flores.

 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de cabinas de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Las Flores” (The Flowers) which is located in the District of San Sebastián in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Veronica is one of the members. She is 30 years old, single, and has one child. She works at her grocery business where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. Veronica works from 6:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. She has been in this business for five years and is doing very well. Through this business, Veronica wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is requesting a loan in order to buy milk, sugar, oil, cookies, and rice.

The member who appears in the attached photo had her picture taken at a later time because she requested permission to be absent for work reasons. The person whose face is covered with a circle is not a member of the Communal Bank “Las Flores”.

The other group members engage in businesses such as selling cakes, managing retail clothing booths, operating a grocery store, and managing a restaurant.

Veronica is grateful to those who have helped to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, cookies, and rice.

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Melina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Melina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ruth is 41 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Ruth has a buy and sell of dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. Ruth requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Jennilyn

texts.en:
Jennilyn is 27 years old and has two children. Jennilyn is married and both of her children are in school.

Jennilyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Jennilyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

Jennilyn has been raising livestock for eight years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Jennilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 60 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 60 años, ya que es una herencia familiar. Él es un hombre de trabajador que desde hace 2 años decidió instalar un pequeño comedor en el cual se sirven desayunos, almuerzos y platillos típicos, y es con lo que ha logrado salir adelante en este tiempo. Manuel desea invertir en el comedor ya que quiere ofrecer más variedad en el menú, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollo, carne, pescado, arroz, bebidas frías y calientes, etc. Para cumplir con la demanda de productos que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manuel is 60 years old and has resided in his own home for 60 years since the property has been in his family. He is a hardworking man who decided to open a small diner two years ago. Manuel serves breakfast, lunch, and traditional dishes. He has been able to succeed over time.

Manuel wants to invest in his diner so that he can offer more variety in his menu. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI. He will invest in chicken, meat, fish, rice, hot and cold beverages, and other items so that he can meet the demand for products that his customers request.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, fish, rice, hot and cold beverages, and other supplies.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. She is married and has an internet cafe business in the Philippines.

Alma requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional unit of computer for her business.

Alma has been in this business for six years now.

Alma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit of computer for her business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 63 years old and married with five children. Anecita works very hard to provide for them.

Anecita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Anecita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, sugar, milk, chocolate drinks, snack foods, candies, shampoo, etc. 

Anecita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bernagen

texts.en:
Bernagen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Bernagen is 51 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Bernagen has a guitar-making business in the Philippines. Bernagen requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Bernagen has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly works hard to support her family. Beverly is married and has a buy and sell of ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Beverly requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Beverly has been in this business for six years now.

Beverly would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear (clothing) to sell to her customers

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 61 years old and married with eight children. Catalina works very hard to provide for them.

Catalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Catalina has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as bath soap, sanitary pads, diapers, toothpaste, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Catalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional unit of bicycle for her bicycle transport business.

Denia has been in this business for four years. Denia earns more income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Denia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional unit of bicycle for her business

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. Conchita is married and has a buy and sell of recyclable materials business in the Philippines.

Conchita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more recyclable materials to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for six years now.

Conchita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more recyclable materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and pay for labor in order to put a concrete floor in her home.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales de pollo, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia pero también vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, adicional a eso también se dedica a la agricultura, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito pero esta vez para la compra de maíz, pollo, verduras, tomates, consomé entre otros ingredientes para seguir con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 63 years old and resides in own home along with her husband. She prepares and sells chicken tamales. Her business is located at her place of residence, but she also sells as a street vendor in different neighborhoods. In addition, she engages in agriculture.

Maria is requesting another loan, but this time she will use the money to buy corn, chicken, vegetables, tomatoes, broth, and other ingredients so that she can continue her sales and have more income.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, vegetables, tomatoes, broth, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio continua  dedicándose al negocio de molinera, el muele granos de trigo, cebada y maíz y lo convierte en harinas y lo reparte en las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes y a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta  forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar maiz, cebada entre otros.
 El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage his milling business where he processes wheat, barley, and corn and turns them into flour, which he delivers to different grocery stores and all of his customers who order from him. He has been in this business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort he puts forth each day into his work. The borrower wants to keep working so that he can continue to support his family.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy corn, barley, and other grains. The borrower is grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy corn, barley, and other grains for processing into flour.

loans.name: Manos De Trabajo Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL MANOS DE TRABAJO ESTA CONFORMADA POR DIES INTEGRANTES NUEVE MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES CON QUINCE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DE  MALPAISILLO, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE OCCIDENTE DEL PAÍS, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL. EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPANIA DE SUS HIJOS, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA BRINDARLE UN FUTURO MEJOR A SUS HIJOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE LA COORDINADORA ES MARÍA MERCEDES Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE CERDOS EN PIE. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNA OCHOS HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SU PRODUCTO. EL OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y COMPRAR UN LOTE DE CERDOS EN PIE PARA LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DEL MISMO. MANOS DE TRABAJO AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES  NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Manos de Trabajo” (Working Hands) consists of 10 members, 9 women and 1 man. They are responsible parents who take care of 15 children among them. The members are originally from Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the western part of the country. They are known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. In their free time, the members enjoy spending time with their children. They are currently striving to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her desire to succeed, María Mercedes was chosen to be the group coordinator. She has a business of buying and selling pigs. Her business is located at her house and she spends eight hours a day offering her product. The purpose of her loan is to invest it as operating capital. She will buy a set of live pigs that she can raise and sell.

“Manos de Trabajo” appreciates the assistance that the Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent living.

loans.use: to buy live pigs that she can raise and sell.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: José es un hombre de 57 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 33 años de edad. Él siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que hace 7 años se gana la vida en una empresa cercana, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con este ingreso económico estable. José desea encementar el piso de su vivienda y repellar las paredes de la misma que están hechas de adobe,  para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso y repellar las paredes de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
José is a 57-year-old man who resides in his own home along with his life companion and their 33-year-old daughter. He is always looking for ways to help his family get ahead. For the past seven years, he has been earning his living at a company nearby. He is happy to have a stable income.

José wants to lay down a concrete floor in his home and to whitewash the walls that are made of adobe. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI. He will invest in cement, sand, and gravel so that he can install the concrete floor and whitewash the walls of his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel so that he can lay down a concrete floor and whitewash the walls of his home.

loans.name: Assucena

texts.pt:
A Sra. Assucena de 28 anos de idade casada e mãe de 3 filhos, 2 estão a frequentar  a escola no ensino primário e 1 è menor de idade . Ela é funcionaria do Ministério de Educação e Cultura Ha mais de 7 anos.
Com o presente empréstimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção ( blocos, cimento, areia, porta janela e pagamento de mão-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Assucena is a 28 year old married mother to 3 chldren: 2 of whom attend primary school and the youngest is of pre-school age. She has been working in the office for the Ministry of Education and Culture for more than 7 years.
She intends to use this loan to buy building materials, such as blocks, cement, sand, doors and windows as well as paying labour costs, so that she can continue with building work on her home.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as blocks, cement, sand, doors and windows as well as to pay labour costs.

loans.name: Lili Elivira

texts.es: Doña Lili es comerciante de ropa, también vende ambientadores, ella es una Sra. soltera que busca mantener sus ingresos vendiendo todos los días desde muy temprano,  sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes quienes le brindan su apoyo para salir adelante. Doña Lili solicita el crédito para invertir en su medio de ingresos la venta ropa, desea comprar variedades de camisas, pantalones entre otros que mantengan surtida su tiendita, así poder vender más y con los ingresos continuar apoyando a su anciana madre a quien ella cuida con mucho amor.
texts.en:
Doña Lili is a clothing merchant, but she also sells air fresheners. She is a single woman who is looking for ways to maintain her income. Lili sells every day, beginning in the early morning hours. Her children are grown and independent, but they provide her with support so that she can move forward.

Doña Lili is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her business of selling clothes. She wants to buy a variety of shirts, trousers, and other products so that she can keep her small store stocked. As a result, she will be able to sell more and use the income to continue supporting her elderly mother who she cares for with great affection.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shirts, trousers, and other products so that she can continue her business and support her mother.

loans.name: Gulnura

texts.ru: Гулнура, 27 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей дошкольного возраста. У Гулнуры среднее образование. Два года она занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. По хозяйству активно помогает супруг. В хозяйстве Гулнуры есть 3 коровы, 4 овцы. Также земельный надел мерою 9,52 ГА, где Гулнура выращивает ячмень и люцерну. Также на ежедневной основе она реализует молоко местным жителям и оптовым покупателям. Ежемесячная прибыль Гулнуры составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого, вкусного, домашнего молока. Доходы от кредита Гулнура направит на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, что позволит в будущем накопить средства на аренду торгового павильона и покупку обуви для перепродажи.
texts.en: Gulnura is 27 years old, married and a mother of 2 preschool-age children. Gulnura has a secondary education. She has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for two years and is an expert in her business. Her husband helps her with the business. Gulnura's farm has 3 cows and 4 sheep. She also has a 9.52-hectare land plot, where she grows barley and alfalfa. In addition, she sells milk to local residents and wholesale customers on a daily basis. Gulnura's mnthly profit amounts to 9,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Gulnura requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 3 dairy cows in order to increase her sales volume of ecologically-clean, delicious, home-made milk. Gulnura will direct the earnings from the loan on further developing her business, which will allow her to save money for leasing a retail pavilion and buying shoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy three dairy cows in order to increase the volume of eco-friendly milk sales and to save money to open a shoe store

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
A Sra. Ana de 46 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 5 filhos, 2 estão a frequentar  a escola no ensino primário e 3 sao independente. Ela é negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade a mais de 15 anos, actividade que esta a ser acompanhada junto com sua filha, seus produtos vende a porta da sua casa e em diversos mercados de Boane.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção ( blocos, cimento, areia, porta janela e pagamento de mão-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Ana is a 46 year old single mother to 5 children: 2 of whom attend primary school and her elder 3 children already live independently. She has been an informal trader of essential goods for more than 15 years, a business which she runs with her daughter's help, selling her products from the door of her home and in various markets in Boane.
She plans to use this loan to buy building materials, such as blocks, cement, sand, doors and windows as well as paying labour costs, so that she can continue with building work on her home.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as blocks, cement, sand, doors and windows as well as to pay labour costs.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt:
A Sra. Gilda de 61 anos de idade solteira e mae de 2 filhos 1 e independente e outro esta a frequentar escola no ensino tecnico. Ela è negociante informal de produtos da 1ª nessecidade no seu estabelicimento comercial, actividade que esta a explorar a mais de 20 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª nessecidade (arroz, amendoim, feijao manteiga, batata doce, rebucados, biscoitos, refregerantes e mais diversos produtos) para aumentar o vulume do seu negocio.
Tem como grande desafio aumentar o volume do seu negocio para garantir a sua reforma.
texts.en:
Gilda is a 61 year old single mother to 2 children, 1 of whom already lives independently and the other attends a technical school. She has been running an informal business selling basic essentials in her shop for more than 20 years.
She intends to use this loan to buy basic essentials, such as rice, peanuts, butter beans, sweet potatoes, candies, biscuits, soft drinks and other items, so that she can increase her business stock level. The greatest challenge she faces is increasing the size of her business in order to guarantee its improvement.

loans.use: to buy basic essentials, such as rice, peanuts, butter beans, sweet potato, candies, biscuits, soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
“When women come together, they are powerful,” says Julia, a 35-year-old farmer who has two children and lives in the village of Kabare in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. As a girl, she watched women in her village mobilize to replace traditional thatched roofs with waterproof corrugated iron. The memory of this collective effort led her to join Songa mbele “moving forward” self-help group. For the past five years she has been actively involved in mixed farming, and because she is from rural Kenya, gender roles still adhere and women do the heavy work of fetching and carrying water and firewood, in addition to household chores, childcare and tending crops. Many are left to run farms alone while their husbands migrate in search of paid employment. This has not been a set back because Julia has been making great profits in farming. 

Kerugoya is one of the places that has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming, that is good climate, soil, transport system, and markets. Julia has always wanted to diversify and start horticulture farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is a lack of funds to get the business off the ground. She is requesting a loan to start horticulture farming. Through Songa mbele self-help group where members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, she joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organisation that supports young and enterprising farmers. With your loan she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, hence making more money. This loan will improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

Help this heroine realize her dreams!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, corrugated galvanized metal sheeting, and nails to replace the roof and cement the floor of his house.

loans.name: Seydi Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora  Seydi de 28  años  de edad es casada, vive con su esposo en su casa  no tiene hijos que dependen  de ella, se dedica desde hace uno ocho años al negocio de venta de comida como almuerzos y cenas, también vende tacos, enchiladas, tajadas, tortillas con quesillo, frescos por mayor, vende todo los días en su casa y tiene una buena clientela.
Doña Seydi es una mujer trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de papas, yuca, repollo, arroz, queso, salsa, pollo, plátanos, aceite, etc. materia prima para su negocio. Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando para salir adelante con sus proyectos de su familia, es su octavo préstamo que solicita. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Seydi, 28 years old, is married, lives with her husband in their house and doesn't have any dependent children. She has worked for some eight years at her business selling food such as lunch and dinner, and also she sells tacos, enchiladas, fried plantains, cheese tortillas, and bulk drinks. She sells from her house every day and has a good customer base.

Seydi is a hard-working woman with great desires to get ahead. She is asking for this loan to purchase potatoes, yucca, cabbage, rice, cheese, sauce, chicken, plantains, oil, etc., which is raw material for her business. With the support of this loan she plans to increase her income and continue working to get ahead with her family projects. It is the eighth loan she has requested. Her dream is to improve her business and her house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, yucca, cabbage, rice, cheese, sauce, chicken, plantains, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Nuray

texts.en:
Nuray is married with two children. Both children are in college. To help support her family and provide for her children’s education needs, she began selling Tupperware on a friend’s advice 8.5 years ago. She makes good money and plans to continue as long as she is well enough. With her second loan she’ll buy promotional materials and increase her sales.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nuray hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  İki çocuğuda üniversite de okuyor.  Ailesine katkı sağlamak ve çocuklarının eğitim ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için bir arkadaşının önerisi ile tupperware satmaya başlıyor.  Sekiz buçuk yıldır bu işi yapıyor ve kazancı çok iyi.  Sağlığı el verdikçe işini devam ettirmek ve çocuklarının eğitimini tamamlamasını istiyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile promosyonlu ürünler alıp satışını arttıracak.

loans.use: to buy promotional material.

loans.name: Luis Hermel

texts.es: Luis esta pasando por sus 43 años de edad, el no se ha casado ya que vive con su madre que es de la tercera edad y esta delicada de salud, por este motivo comenta que él trabaja duro y se ocupa totalmente de su madre, Luis se dedica  a la agricultura y tiene criadero de cuyes y de chanchos ya que estos negocios son su fuente de ingresos, Luis necesita el crédito para comprar cuyes y de este negocio aspira seguir trabajando y mejorar sus ingresos y a la vez que esta pendiente de su negocio también estar cuidando a su madre.
texts.en: Luis is 43 years old, he has not married since he lives with his mother who is a senior citizen and has delicate health, for this reason he says that he works hard and takes complete care of his mother. Luis works in agriculture and raises guinea pigs and pigs, since these businesses are his source of income. Luis needs a loan to purchase guinea pigs and from this business he hopes to continue working and improve his income and at the same time that he is watching his business, he can also be caring for his mother.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El señor Sergio de 62  años de  edad, vive en su casa  junto con su esposa y sus hijos, se dedica desde hace 1 año  al negocio de venta de ropa Americana, ropa nueva, zapatos, computadoras, teclados, celulares, lociones, etc.   Sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y también personas que transitan por la zona.
Don Sergio vive en San Lorenzo Valle al sur de Honduras,  es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materiales de construcción como varillas, cemento, ladrillos, etc.  Porque le es urgente reparar su local de trabajo, ya que se encuentra en mal estado y también desea comprar por lo menos 2 fardos de ropa clasificada como blusas, vestidos, faldas, camisas, etc.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Sergio, 62 years old, lives in his house with his wife and their children. For one year, he has worked in a business selling American clothing, new clothing, shoes, computers, keyboards, cell phones, lotions, etc. His customers are all his neighbors and also people who travel through the zone.

Sergio lives in San Lorenzo, Valle in the south of Honduras. He is an enterprising man with desire to get ahead and struggle day by day to improve his quality of life. He is asking for a loan to purchase construction materials such as rods, cement, bricks, etc. because it is urgent to repair his work space, since it is in bad condition and also he wants to purchase at least 2 lots of classified clothing such as blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, etc.

His dream is to grow his business to improve his quality of life. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2014.

loans.use: to purchase rods, cement, bricks, blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, etc. for his house and his business.

loans.name: Lorena Lizeth

texts.es:
La señora Lorena de 24  años de edad vive su esposo en su casa de habitación ubicada en aldea paso San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras,  se dedica desde hace cinco años al negocio de elaboración y venta de utensilios de barro, como adornos de forma tortugas, cusucos, floreros, gallos, cubetas, platos, etc. 
Doña Lorena la mayoría de sus clientes son los que transitan hacia el Salvador y de regreso los que viajan hacia Tegucigalpa,  vende variedad de piezas de artesanía es un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación, actualmente ya está asociada a una cooperativa de artesanos donde también expone sus piezas de arte en otras ciudades.
Doña Lorena solicita el préstamo para la compra de tierra, leña y pintura que son la materia prima para elaborar sus productos,  con el apoyo de este crédito  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y suplir la necesidad de financiamiento. Su sueño es graduarse de la universidad y tener un mejor taller con varias operarias.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Lorena, 24 years old, lives with her husband in a house located in the village of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She has worked for five years in the business of making and selling clay items, such as decorations in the shape of turtles, armadillos, vases, roosters, trays, plates, etc. 

The majority of Lorena's customers are those who travel to El Salvador and in the other direction, those who travel to Tegucigalpa. She sells a variety of craft items and is an example of work and dedication. She is now a member of a craft cooperative where she also shows her artwork in other cities.

Lorena asks for the loan to purchase clay, firewood, and paint, which are her raw materials for making her products. With the support of this loan, she plans to increase her income, and fill her financial need. Her dream is to graduate from the university and have a better workshop with various workers.  

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to purchase clay, firewood and paint for her business.

loans.name: Lidia Yesenia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia Yesenia de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio de venta de comida, lo que son sus clientes son todas los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad.
Doña Lidia Yesenia vive en San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Lidia Yesenia está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como carnes de cerdo y res, arroz, papas, frijoles, verduras, pollo, frescos, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Lidia Yesenia is 39 years old, lives with her husband and her child in their own house. She has worked for 5 years in the business of selling food. Her customers are all friends and neighbors from the community.

Lidia Yesenia lives in San Lorenzo, Valle al Sur in Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with desires to get ahead and struggle day by day to improve her quality of life. 

Lidia Yesenia is asking for the loan to purchase products such as pork, beef, potatoes, beans, vegetables, chicken, soft drinks, etc. With the support of this loan, she plans to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a client with the desire to work with Prisma. Her dream is to have a good business and increase her customer base, and at the same time improve her future with her family. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2014.

loans.use: to purchase pork and beef, rice, potatoes, beans, vegetables, chicken, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Griselda Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Griselda de 43  años de edad, vive con sus hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio ella vende  frescos, azúcar, mortadelas, pan,  churros, frijoles, arroz,  lácteos, jabón, pollo, escobas, cepillos,  etc. 
Doña Griselda vive en una aldea de Buenos Aires, al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.  
Doña Griselda está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería como pollo, arroz, frijoles, maseca, manteca, jabón, frescos, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Griselda, 43, lives with her children in her own house. She has been selling groceries for ten years. In her business, she sells soft drinks, sugar, mortadella, bread, churros, beans, rice, dairy products, soap, chicken, brooms, brushes, etc.

Griselda lives in a village of Buenos Aires in the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with a desire to succeed. She fights every day to improve her quality of life. 

Griselda is applying for a loan to buy products to stock her business, such as chicken, rice, beans, instant corn mix, butter, soap, soft drinks, etc. With the support of this loan, she plans to improve her income and her quality of life. She is a new client who wishes to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good, well-stocked business, as well as to improve her future along with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, beans, instant corn mix, butter, soap, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lilia Sarahi

texts.es:
La señora Lilia de 27  años de edad, vive con sus  hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende frescos, churros, frijoles, arroz, lácteos, jabón, pollo, azúcar, papel higiénico, salsas, pan, galletas,  etc.
Doña Lilia vive en una ciudad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Lilia está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería como frescos, arroz, azúcar, maíz, aceite, harina, huevos, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
