Lilia, 27, lives with her children in her own house. She has been selling groceries for 5 years. In her business, she sells soft drinks, churros, beans, rice, dairy products, soap, chicken, sugar, toilet paper, sauce, bread, cookies, etc.

Lilia lives in a city in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with a desire to succeed. She fights every day to improve her quality of life.

Lilia is applying for a loan to buy products to stock her grocery store, such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, corn, oil, flour, eggs, etc. With the support of this loan, she plans to improve her income as well as her quality of life. She is a client who wishes to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good, well-stocked business as well as to improve her future along with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, sugar, corn, oil, flour, eggs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Kelvin Rolando

texts.es:
Kelvin Rolando tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos dependientes, vive con sus padres. Kelvin Rolando vive en caserío Puente Techin, en el distrito de Púcara, el cual es un distrito mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, cuya actividades principales son el comercio y la agricultura. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Kelvin Rolando se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual trabaja, él realiza su servicio de transporte público en el distrito de Pucará y caseríos cercanos, cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, Kelvin Rolando es natural de Pucará, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, solvencia moral y económica, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el mantenimiento de su unidad móvil, invirtiendo en su herramienta de trabajo Kelvin Rolando podrá asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de la misma y por ende le permitirá seguir generando ingresos.
texts.en:
Kelvin Rolando, 24, is single and does not have any dependent children. He lives with his parents in the village of Puente Techin in the district of Púcara. It is a midsize district with a desire to improve. The main activities are trade and agriculture. This district is located in the province of Jaén in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Kelvin Rolando makes a living offering transportation services. He has his own motorcycle taxi to work with. He offers his transportation services in the district of Pucará and neighboring villages. He has more than five years of experience in this field. Kelvin Rolando is a native of Pucará and has very good personal references, financial and moral character. He will use this loan to invest in the maintenance of his vehicle. By investing in his working tool, Kelvin Rolando will be able to ensure its proper functioning, which will allow him to continue earning an income.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para damas y caballeros y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, 34, lives in her own house with her life partner and her two children. She has made a living selling clothing for several years. She travels to make sales in different communities. She is applying for a loan to buy more wholesale clothing for men and women to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es una mujer de 47 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 15 y 19 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, generosa, amable, independiente, activa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘el Torno’ una comunidad rural ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad en automóvil, caracterizada por el comercio agrícola que reúne a productores campesinos y vendedores/distribuidores de la ciudad, el clima del lugar es cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante en día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Marcela es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su trabajo es la venta de comida rápida como; hamburguesas, salchipapas, sándwiches, y otros, en un puesto de venta fijo en su domicilio. Debido al paso del tiempo, las constantes lluvias y la humedad, las paredes y techo se han deteriorado causando grietas y rajaduras en la pared y techo de su negocio. Esto causa mal aspecto y pérdidas de ventas. “la comida rápida tiene gran demanda por aquellas personas que quieren un bocadillo al paso, saliendo de sus trabajos o que no cocinan en sus casas…” comenta. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales para que no tengan que vivir de un oficio. Ella desea refaccionar su negocio realizando la compra de estuco, pinturas y otros para arreglar el techo y las paredes. Este es el 2 ciclo de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marcela solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su puesto de venta de comida rápida y atraer a mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Marcela is a 47-year-old woman, single, has three children ages 5, 15, and 19, and her business is selling fast food.

She is a good mother, enterprising, generous, friendly, independent, active, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in the "El Torno" locality, a rural community located 45 minutes from the city by car, characterized by agricultural trade, which unites the rural producers and sellers/distributors in the city. The climate in the area is warm, tropical, and humid, with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees centigrade during the whole year. 

Marcela has olive skin, is short, has long black hair she keeps tied up, her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish from school and for the business she does. Her work is selling fast food such as hamburgers, potatoes and hotdogs, sandwiches and others, in a permanent food stall in her home. Due to the passing of time, the constant rain and the humidity, the walls and the roof have deteriorated, causing cracks and splits in the wall and the roof of her business. This makes it look bad and causes losses in her sales. "Fast food has a high demand by those people who want a snack in passing, leaving from their jobs or who don't cook at home..." she says. Her dream is that her children become professionals so as not to have to live on a trade. She wants to repair her business, purchasing stucco, paint and other things to repair the roof and the walls. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the 6 years that she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Marcela asks for a loan to repair her fast food stall and attract more customers.

loans.use: to repair her fast food stall and attract more customers.

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuela, de 59 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casada, y tiene 5 hijos pero todos tienen sus propios hogares.- 

Manuela, se dedica a la crianza y al comercio de pollos de engorde, su madre fue quien le enseñó este oficio.- Tiene varios años de comercializar en el mercado del municipio donde reside y en los alrededores de su vivienda.

Manuela, ocupará el crédito para comprar pollos de engorde y gallinas ponedoras para ampliar su negocio y para iniciar la venta de huevos e incrementar sus ingresos.

Manual, planea ampliar más su negocio con gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
Manuela, 59 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade, is married, and has 5 children, but all have their own homes.

Manuela works raising and selling fattened chickens. Her mother was the one who taught her this trade. She has a number of years of experience selling in the municipal market where she lives and in the area near her home.

Manuela will use the loan to purchase chickens to fatten and laying hens to expand her business and begin selling eggs and increase her income. 

Manuela plans to expand her business more with laying hens.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to fatten and laying hens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale chickens.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia, who used her previous loan to buy beans for planting, is a 33-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a retail shop, as well as working as a farmer, and with the income she earns she has been able to educate her children. Her main hardship is competition from other traders. She has a vision of expanding her business into a wholesale shop to serve her customers' increasing demands.

Jalia is requesting a loan to buy more crates of soda, salt, sugar, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda, salt, sugar, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, de 49 años de edad, es profesor y está casado, heredó su vocación de sus padres ya que ellos eran profesores.- Sus hijos se dedican a estudiar ya que desean llegar a enseñar igual que su padre y sus abuelos.

Juan, se levanta a las 5:30 a.m. para alistarse y llegar a tiempo a su trabajo porque tiene que caminar alrededor de una hora, la distancia no es impedimento para Juan, porque el disfruta enseñando sus conocimientos a sus alumnos y posee más de 20 años en esta profesión que le gusta tanto. 

Juan, necesita comprar un vehículo ya que lo necesita para transportarse a su lugar de trabajo y llevar más seguro su material didáctico.

El planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo y del préstamo para la compra del vehículo podrá en un futuro mandar a sus hijos a estudiar una carrera universitaria para que lleguen a ser hombres de bien y útiles para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Juan, 49, is married and works as a teacher. He inherited this profession from his parents, as they were also teachers. His children are studying because they would like to teach someday, just like their father and grandparents.

Juan wakes up at 5:30am to get ready and arrive at work on time, since he has to walk for about an hour. The distance is not an obstacle for Juan because he enjoys teaching and giving his knowledge to his students. He has been in this profession, which he greatly enjoys, for more than twenty years.

Juan needs to buy a vehicle in order to commute to work and transport his teaching materials more safely.

With his income from his job and from this loan to buy a vehicle, he plans to send his children to study a university degree in the future so that they can become good men who are useful to society.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Jaime Alexander

texts.es:
Jaime de 21 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado de educación básica, por motivos económicos dejo de estudiar. Su compañera de vida es comerciante, solo ella y su hija viven con él.

Jaime trabaja haciendo viajes con su vehículo desde hace tres años, aprendió de su padre, que se dedicaba a lo mismo y fue él quien le dio su vehículo para que Jaime trabajara, cuando no le salen viajes, vende camarones junto a su esposa de casa en casa en su comunidad, cuando tiene camarón para vender, su pareja elabora refrescos naturales y Jaime sale a venderlos en su bicicleta en los caseríos cercanos. Su compañera comienza el día a las 4:30 am cuando hay que hacer viaje, ya que él salea a las 5:00 am, trabaja 12 horas al día, pero cuando es de vender camarón o refrescos solo trabaja 6 horas por la tarde.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una motocicleta usada, para vender el camarón en comunidades más lejanas y abrir nuevas zonas de trabajo. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Jaime, 21, is in a common-law marriage and has a three-year-old daughter. He studied up until the sixth grade of basic education. He stopped studying due to financial reasons. His life partner is a merchant. Only she and their daughter live with him.

Jaime has been making trips with his vehicle for three years. He learned from his father, who worked in the same profession and who gave Jaime his vehicle so that he could work. When he does not have any trips, he sells shrimp door-to-door with his wife in their community when they have shrimp to sell. His partner makes natural soft drinks and Jaime goes out to sell them on his bicycle in the neighboring communities. His partner starts the day at 4:30am when there is a need to make a trip, and he leaves at 5:00am. He works for 12 hours per day, but if he is selling shrimp or soft drinks, he only works for six hours in the afternoon.

He is applying for a loan to buy a used motorcycle in order to sell shrimp in communities which are farther away, opening up new areas of work. His dream is to buy land and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Lamzar

texts.ru: Ламзар, 42 года, женат, есть 3 детей, самому младшему сыну - 4 года. У Ламзара- среднее образование, он 15 лет назад начал заниматься сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день в его хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 4 овцы. Семья с радостью помогает Ламзару по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 87,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации молока.  Доходы от кредита Ламзар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Lamzar is 42 years old, married and has three children - the youngest of whom is four years old. Lamzar has a secondary education. Fifteen years ago, he started his own agricultural business. Her currently has 3 cows and 4 sheep on his farm. Lamzar's family gladly helps him with his farm work. For the further development of his business, he turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." He is requesting a loan for 87,000 som (KGS) to buy dairy cows to increase the volume of his milk sales. Lamzar plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock so that he can save money to repair his house.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows to increase the volume of his milk sales.

loans.name: Elias Alonso

texts.es: Elías de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una fosa séptica en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra y asi puedan vivir con su familia comodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en: Elías, 60, lives in his own house with his wife. He has made a living in agriculture for 20 years. He would like to improve his home by building a septic tank in the area shown in the photograph, but he does not have sufficient capital to do so. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to buy cement, sand, and bricks, and to pay workers. He will then be able to live comfortably with his family in a clean space.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.en:
Bahtiyor is a handsome man. He was born in 1993. He lives in a village with his family and he is single. Bahtiyor is a strong, hardworking, and clever boy. His father works as a livestock man. His father's annual income from his work does not cover expenditures. Every year his father goes working abroad. 

Bahtiyor wants to graduate from a university. His goal is to be a teacher. He hopes that being educated will help him to teach others in his area. His believes that he has an obligation to be helpful to his community. Bahtiyor needs financial support to pay the tuition at his university.

loans.use: To pay for tuition at his university

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a 45-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer and at the same time does farming. He faces challenges of high competition and price fluctuations, like other retailers. However, he hopes to have a good business and to educate his children to higher levels of learning. Deo needs a loan to plaster and floor his house.

loans.use: to plaster and floor his house.

loans.name: Rosa Idis

texts.es:
Rosa de 35 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 4 hijos de 18, 17, 12 y 10 años de edad y todos están estudiando, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, su pareja es albañil y solo él y sus hijos viven con ella.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió de sus padres, además tiene cuatro cabezas de ganado y cría cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos. La parcela donde siembra está a unos 15 minutos caminando desde su casa y en esta actividad le apoyan sus hijos.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar ganado de engorde para venderlo posteriormente. Espera seguir trabajando con el ganado para dar a sus hijos el estudio y que algún día trabajen de algo que les guste.
texts.en:
Rosa, 35, is in a common-law marriage and has four children, ages 10, 12, 17 and 18. All of them are studying. She did not have the opportunity to study. Her partner is a construction worker. Only he and the children live with her.

Rosa makes a living in agriculture, an activity which she learned about from her parents. She also has four animals and she raises pigs to fatten and sell. The plot of land where she plants crops is located 15 minutes away from her house by foot. Her children support her in this activity.

She is applying for a loan to buy livestock to fatten and then sell. She hopes to continue working with livestock to give her children the opportunity to study, so that one day they can work in a profession which they like.

loans.use: to buy livestock to fatten.

loans.name: Manzurahon

texts.ru: Манзурахон 54 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование - среднее. Уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Манзурахон достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 12,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Манзурахон имеется 5 коров и 4 овцы. На участке мерою 0,24 Га она выращивает картофель. По хозяйству помогают супруг и дети. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья и семян картофеля. Доходы от кредита Манзурахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве и накопить на завершение строительства дома для ее семьи.
texts.en: Manzurahon is 54 years old, married and has 2 daughters. She has a secondary education. She has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming for many years. Thanks to her backbreaking labor and intensive work, Manzurahon achieved great success in developing her farm. Her average monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). Manzurahon currently has 5 cows and 4 sheep on her farm. She also has a 0.24 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes. Her husband and children help her with her farm. For the further development of her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 80,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd and to buy potato seeds. Manzurahon plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock for her farm. She also wants to save money to finish the construction on her family's house.

loans.use: to purchase cows and potato seeds.

loans.name: Bros

texts.en:
Bros is a 23-year-old student who is studying banking and finance.  He is in his second year at university in a city. Bros is hardworking and always spends time helping his parents with rice farming.

Due to a shortage of finances to pay his tuition fees for three years, Bros has decided to secure a loan. With this loan, he will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree and have skills for his future job. For his future plans after graduation, Bros wants to work in a bank and save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta es una mujer de 33 años de edad y se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de huevos, detergente, y prendas de vestir, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con este ingreso económico, que le permite sostener a su familia. Ella es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos de 14, 9 y 7 años de edad. Marta pone todo su esfuerzo para sacar adelante a sus hijos con su negocio, por lo que desea ampliar el mismo y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: prendas de vestir, detergente, huevos, etc., para continuar con su negocio y poder ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Marta, 33, makes a living selling eggs, detergent, and clothing. She has had this business activity for 15 years, and she is happy to have this financial income which allows her to maintain her family. She is a single mother and she lives in her own house with her three children, ages 7, 9 and 14. Marta puts all of her effort into providing for her children with her business, which is why she would like to expand it. Therefore, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in clothing, detergent, eggs, etc. to continue with her business and offer a greater quantity of products to her clients.

loans.use: to invest in clothing, detergent, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía de 67 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de productos básicos actividad que realiza en su vivienda desde hace 5 años y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 50 años de edad desde hace 5 años. Rosalía desea surtir más su negocio ya que sabe que los productos de una tienda son muchos y no cuenta con todos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arroz, frijoles, pan dulce, golosinas, leche, cereal, bebidas frías, etc. Para ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Rosalía, 67, is an enterprising woman who makes a living with her business selling basic products. She has had this business activity in her home for five years, and it has allowed her to provide for her family. She has lived in her own home with her 50-year-old son for five years. Rosalía would like to stock her business, because she knows that there are many store products and she does not have all of them. Therefore, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in rice, beans, sweet bread, candy, milk, cereal, cold drinks, etc. to offer a greater variety of products to her clients.

loans.use: to invest in rice, beans, sweet bread, candy, milk, cereal, cold drinks, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 58 years old. She is a widow blessed with seven children between the ages of 36 and 22.

Alice sells charcoal,a business she has done for the last 30 years. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. She also sells second-hand clothes.

Alice has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy additional sacks of charcoal for resale during this festive season.

Alice's hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a plot of land and build her house.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Nebahat

texts.en:
Nebahat is married and has four children. She has sold Tupperware for two years. She lives in a village and keeps cows, selling the milk for her income. At first she just used Tupperware. Later, when her friends wanted it too, she began selling it. Nebahat gets up early to take care of and milk the cows and does her errands before she begins selling Tupperware. She goes to a Tupperware meeting once a week. She says she likes working a lot and enjoys selling Tupperware. With this loan she will buy more products to sell. She is an example for her daughters-in-law.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nebahat Hanım evli dört çocuk annesi.  Nebahat Hanım iki yıldır tupperware satışı yapıyor.  Köyde yaşıyor .  İnekleri  var ve bunların sütünü satarak gelir elde ediyor.  İlk olarak Tupperware kullanıcısı olarak başlıyor.  Daha sonra çevresi de isteyince satmaya başlıyor.  Sabah erken kalkıp ineklerine bakıp sütünü sağdıkdan sonra günlük işlerine dönüyor ve tupperware siparişlerini satmaya başlıyor.  Haftanın bir günü de tupperware toplantılarına katılıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile ürün alacak.  Çalışmayı çok sevdiğini söylüyor.  Gelinlerine de örnek olmuş.  Tupperware satmaya teşvik etmiş.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell for her Tupperware business

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela, de 62 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, es viuda.- Adela, se dedica a la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y de su esposo. Ella se levanta junto a sus hijos a las 5:30 a.m. para realizar sus actividades diarias, que se enfocan en la agricultura y el cuido de ganado.

Adela, trabaja la agricultura en las parcelas que posee, en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a ordeñar las vacas, la leche que obtiene la ocupa para elaborar quesos o requesón para vender.

Con el préstamo, Adela comprará una vaca lechera que le vende una vecina para incrementar la producción de leche y poder incrementar sus ingresos. 

Adela, planea en un futuro construir un lugar con techo, para poder tener sus animales y que no se mojen para el invierno.
texts.en:
Adela, 62 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade, and is a widow. Adela works in agriculture. She learned this trade from her parents and her husband. She gets up with her children at 5:30 am to do the daily chores, which center on agriculture and the care of the livestock. 

Adela works farming the land that she owns. As the afternoon passes, she works milking the cows. She uses the milk that she gets to make cheese or cottage cheese to sell.

With the loan, Adela will purchase a dairy cow, that her neighbor is selling her, to increase her milk production and be able to increase her income.

Adela plans in the future to build a shelter with a roof to be able to have her animals not get wet in the winter.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Herlyn Jesús

texts.es: Herlyn,  es un emprendedor hombre de 32 años, residente en un barrio de Barranquilla, su negocio inició cuando se encontraba viviendo en Burgos – España en año 2010, los amigos en Colombia le pedían que les enviara camisetas de diferentes jugadores de equipos de futbol, así comenzó a vender ropa deportiva. Cuando regresó a Colombia quedó contactado con un proveedor y actualmente le siguen suministrando los pedidos de ropa que le solicitan.  Herlyn es padre de un niño de 8 años de edad, a quien desea brindar un buen porvenir. Él se dedica a esta actividad los fines de semana, en los horarios de 4 p.m. a 9 p.m., su sueño de prosperidad es incrementar el número de clientes y tener más utilidades. Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará ropa deportiva, jeans, blusas, camisas y suéteres para ofrecer a sus clientes.  Esta inversión renovará el surtido y con ello motivará las ventas, sus clientes cancelan en cómodas cuotas las compras que realizan, sin embargo él compra de contado por eso es necesario una inyección de capital.
texts.en: Herlyn, is an enterprising man, 32 years old, resident of a neighborhood in Barranquilla. He began his business when he was living in Burgos, Spain, in the year 2010. Friends in Colombia asked him to send shirts for players on different soccer teams, so he began to sell athletic clothing. When he came back to Colombia, he kept in contact with a provider and currently they continue to supply his clothing orders. Herlyn is the father of an 8-year-old boy, who he wants to offer a good future. He works in this business on the weekends, from 4 pm to 9 pm. His dream of prosperity is to increase the number of customers he has and have more utility. Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase athletic clothing, jeans, blouses, shirts and sweaters to offer his customers. This investment will update his stock and, with it, motivate sales. His customers will pay for the purchases they make in comfortable payments. However, he will purchase with cash, so an injection of capital is necessary.

loans.use: to purchase athletic clothing, jeans, blouses, shirts and sweaters to offer his customers.

loans.name: Alban

texts.en:
This borrower is Alban. He is 24 and single and lives with his entire family in the southern part of Kosovo. He is requesting a  loan because he hasn’t been able to complete the work needed on the walls of his home, providing his family with much improved living conditions and a better quality of life. Alban continues to work for his employer at a private company, but also continues to seek better employment. 

Now, Alban is requesting a loan in order to finish the second floor of his home and do some general renovations that are needed there. He knows that the loan will continue to improve life for his family and hopes that he has proved he is a good client from his first loan. He promises to pay on time and again appreciates all of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to finish the second floor of his home and do some general renovations that are needed

loans.name: Jypargul

texts.ru: Жыпаргул успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 1 дойная корова. Жыпаргул по-прежнему реализует молоко и национальные напитки на центральном рынке села.  Ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жыпаргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена для скота. Доходы от кредита Жыпаргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Jypargul successfully paid off her previous loan, using it for its designated purpose. She is thankful to Kiva and to all those who financed her last loan. She currently has 1 dairy cow on her farm. As in the past, Jypargul sells milk and Central Asian dairy beverages at the central market of her village. Her average monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, Jypargul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 25,000 som (KGS) to buy hay for her cow. Jypargul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy hay to feed her cow.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites owns and manages a motorcycle transport service, commonly called a habal-habal (a highly improvised two-wheeled single motorcycle, usually ridden beyond its passenger capacity). The habal-habal is used especially in remote villages with rough and narrow roads. Marites is 49 years old, married, and has eight children. Four of her children are still attending school. To have an additional source of income, she raises and sells hogs.

Marites is asking for a loan in the amount of 22,000 PHP to buy motorcycle parts like nuts, bolts, and tires, and to pay for repair and maintenance. This way, she can provide her passengers with a hassle-free ride. In addition, the passengers safety is her top priority. With these improvements, Marites will be able to generate a higher income that will help pay the family's daily expenses.

Marites is trying her best to handle her current business successfully for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts like nuts, bolts, and tires, and to pay for repair and maintenance

loans.name: Ludie

texts.en:
Ludie is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari, or retail store, business selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

Ludie is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, rice, biscuits, and snack foods. With this loan, she will be able to improve her product inventory thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Ludie hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, rice, biscuits, and snack foods

loans.name: Aladino

texts.es:
Aladino tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Aladino es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, ubicado en el Caserio Naranjitos - Pomahauca, con una experiencia en el rubro de 6 años, el préstamo que se le otorgara lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
Aladino is 30 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Pomahuaca, a community that works in agriculture, trade and raising livestock, located in the province of Jaén, which is part of the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru. The loan is for agricultural work, applying phytosanitary treatments, fertilizers, and paying labor costs for the harvest. 

The work that Aladino does is agriculture, specifically coffee cultivation, located in the village of Naranjitos - Pomahauyca, with 6 years of experience in the field. The loan granted to him will be used in agricultural work, applying phytosanitary treatments, fertilizers and paying labor costs for the harvest. In this way, it will help him to improve his crop physiologically, morphologically, and productively, and in this way he will have a good harvest, with the end of having better production, a better quality product, for which he won't have any problems selling his product..

loans.use: to pay for agricultural work, applying phytosanitary treatments, fertilizers, and labor costs for the harvest.

loans.name: Stacey

texts.en:
Stacey, aged 20, is a mixed farmer who has been doing farming for the past two years and really enjoys farming. Her primary sources of income are crop farming, dairy farming, and personal business, and through these ventures she has been able to make ends meet. Stacey is a caring mother of one adorable child whom she really treasures because she is the “apple of the eye.” Stacey and her family live in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has good weather patterns that support farming activities.

Stacey is very enterprising, and through farming, she has been able to support her family, although she has been facing challenges. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements that will assist her to produce more. With the loan, Stacey will be able to completely turn around her life because the production level on her farm will increase, and this means more income. With the loan, she will be able to ensure her family has improved living standards, and she is confident that the new profits will allow her to comfortably repay the loan. In the future, Stacey intends to purchase more land with the savings she will make, and this will also give her family a brighter future.

You can help this woman improve her farming, provide for her child, and be able to give her a solid education. Help her out!

loans.use: To buy farm implements that will help her produce more

loans.name: Meerbanbu

texts.ru: Мээрбанбу, 60 лет, вдова, дети все взрослые и самостоятельные. У Мээрбанбу среднее образование, с 1980 года она занимается земледелием и животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Мээрбанбу есть земельный участок мерою 3,0 Га, где она выращивает клевер, и есть 2 коровы, 15 овец и 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход Мээрбанбу составляет в среднем 10,000 сомов (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь. Мээрбанбу очень трудолюбива и ответственна, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Мээрбанбу увеличить ее хозяйство, построить сарай для скота и улучшить материальное состояние.
texts.en: Meerbanbu is 60 years old and a widow. All of her children are grown-up and independent. Meerbanbu has a secondary education. Since 1980, she has been practicing crop farming and livestock breeding. Meerbanbu has a 3.0 hectare plot of land on which she grows clover. She also has 2 cows, 15 sheep and 2 horses on her farm. Meerbanbu's average monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). However, this amount is catastrophically not enough for a decent life. Meerbanbu is very hardworking and responsible. She turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a 70,000 som (KGS) loan to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. The earnings from the loan will allow Meerbanbu to build a barn for her cattle and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Salina, a farmer from a remote village in Barsombe in the Eldoret area of Kenya. She resides with her handsome husband with whom she is blessed with one beautiful child. Salina has been actively involved in farming for the last 12 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she is facing is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

Salina is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. She will use the excess maize she has to feed her poultry, and she will feed them sorghum to give them energy and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate into more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, Salina will increase her output of poultry meat, and this will also increase her income and profit margins. With increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. In addition to better profits, Salina is going to benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is a very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money by not having to buy fertilizer.

Your loan will bring joy to this family because she will be able to support her family and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Adelna

texts.en:
Adelna is from Carles, Iloilo. She is 40 years old and married with 11 children to support. Eight of them are still aged 3 to 16. Adelna works hard in order to make both ends meet. She helps in fishing together with her husband to provide for their children. She is asking a loan to replace some boat parts and buy fishing equipment. She will use it to buy an engine, a boat propeller, a steering assembly, a steering rod, an anchor and ropes.

Adelna believes in reaping what she sows, and a loan will help a lot to make her business a success. Her income will keep her children in school, provide healthy meals for her family and savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy an engine, a boat propeller, a steering assembly, a steering rod, an anchor and ropes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a barber's chair and supplies such as shampoo, razor blades, talcum powder, lotions, and other products necessary for its functioning.

loans.name: Dora Maribel

texts.es: Dora es una mujer de 33 años de edad que se gana la vida comprando y vendiendo huevos y prendas de vestir desde hace 10 años, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos como madre soltera, brindándoles lo mejor que está en sus manos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando con su apoyo. Dora desea invertir en su negocio ya que desea comprar por mayoreo para obtener un mayor margen de ganancia y ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes a menor precio, por lo solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en huevos y prendas de vestir por mayor.
texts.en: Dora is a 33 year old woman who makes her living buying and selling eggs and clothing. She has been doing this for 10 years and thanks to this she has managed to bring up her children. As a single mother she was responsible for providing them with the best. She lives in her own house with her two children aged 13 and 15 years old who are studying with her support. Dora wants to invest in her business as she wants to buy wholesale to obtain a higher margin of profit and offer better quality products to her customers at a lower price. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in eggs and clothing wholesale.

loans.use: to invest in eggs and clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es:
Marino tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos y esposa en el Caserío San Juan Bautista, una zona rural de distrito de Callayuc, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Marino se dedica al cultivo de café, desde hace 8 años en el caserío San Juan Bautista. El destino del crédito es para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, insectisidas, entre otros para el mantenimiento de su finca. Pues manteniendo sus fincas obtendrá mayores rendimientos. Marino posee conocimientos en el cultivo de café. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marino is 38 years old and lives with his children and his wife in the village of San Juan Bautista, a rural zone in the district of Callayuc, whose population works in agriculture, trade and raising livestock, located in the province of Cutervo, which is in Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. 

Marino has worked growing coffee for the past 8 years in the village of San Juan Bautista. The destination of the loan is to purchase manure, fertilizer, insecticide, and other supplies to maintain his fields.

By maintaining his fields, he will get better results. Marino has knowledge of coffee cultivation which will allow him in the short term to improve his income, increase his earnings, and will later will improve his quality of live and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elvie is 36 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Elvie has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle.

Elvie has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 36 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like eggs, shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, vinegar, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Helen has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items.

Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like eggs, shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, vinegar, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Helen is 48 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Helen has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Helen has been in this business for two years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 25 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Гульмиры среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она с 2010 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Гульмиры, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы и 2 овцы. На участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает арбузы и кукурузу. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). Гульмира является лидером группы "Асема", в которой кроме нее состоят еще два человека, всего их трое. Гульмира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) для закупки клеенки для парника, семян помидоров и перца для выращивания экологически чистых и полезных овощей. Гульмира намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en: Gulmira is 25 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising two children. Gulmira has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she has been practicing crop farming and livestock breeding since 2010. Thanks to Gulmira's perseverance, determination and hard work, she currently has 2 cows and 2 sheep on her farm. She also has a 1.0 hectare plot of land on which she grows watermelons and corn. Her average monthly cumulative income is 15,000 som (KGS). Gulmira is the leader of the borrowing group "Asema." There are two other members in the group, three altogether. Gulmira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a 35,000 som (KGS) loan to buy oilcloth for her greenhouse, as well as tomato and pepper seeds to grow organic, healthy vegetables. Gulmira is determined to expand her business, which will fundamentally increase her family's financial resources.

loans.use: to purchase oilcloth for her greenhouse, as well as tomato and pepper seeds to grow organic produce.

loans.name: Elsa Cristina

texts.es: Elsa es una emprendedora mujer de 55 años, residente en un barrio de Barranquilla, está dedicada a la impresión de volantes con los resultados de las loterías que se juegan en Colombia, la idea de negocio de esta carismática mujer surgió, gracias a una amiga que le consiguió unos contratos y desde entonces se ha dedicado a esta actividad.  Con nueve años de experiencia, Elsa ha logrado fidelizar a sus clientes, por el excelente servicio y calidad de sus productos.  Ella presta sus servicios a crédito y pacta en los contratos que tiene con las loterías todas las condiciones de entrega y las fechas de pago.  Sus insumos los compra a distribuidores mayoristas a quienes les cancela de contado. Elsa esta necesitando una inyección de capital, por eso actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará una nueva impresora, papel y tinta, para aumentar la productividad del taller;  esta inversión mejorará la calidad de sus productos y con ello su nitidez y ahorro de insumos. Elsa es madre de un hijo de 32 años y una hija de 28,  su gran propósito es remodelar su vivienda, así mismo fidelizar a su clientela, ofreciéndole excelentes precios y buen surtido.  Su meta de negocio es lograr otros contratos de impresión.
texts.en: Elsa is an enterprising woman, 55 years old, resident of a neighborhood in Barranquilla. She works printing flyers with the results of the lotteries that are played in Colombia. This charismatic woman's idea for the business came thanks to a friend who got her some contracts and since then she has worked in this business. With nine years of experience, Elsa has managed to gain the loyalty of her customers with her excellent service and quality products. She offers her services on credit and signs contracts with the lotteries, all with delivery conditions and payment dates. She buys her supplies from distributors and wholesalers who she pays with cash. Elsa needs an injection of capital, so she is now applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase a new printer, paper and ink, to increase the productivity of her shop. This investment will improve the quality of her products and, with this, her image definition and savings of supplies. Elsa is the mother of a 32-year-old son and a 28-year-old daughter. Her purpose is to remodel her house, and also to build loyal customers, offering them excellent prices and good supplies. Her business goal is to get other printing contracts.

loans.use: to purchase a new printer, paper and ink.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 65-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer who also raises cattle, selling their hides and skins to earn extra income. He started this business to generate income and meet family demands. 

While he hopes eventually to have a sustainable business without borrowed funds, his current main challenge is inadequate capital to meet that goal. He is therefore requesting this loan to buy mulch and improve his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy mulch and improve his  banana plantation.

loans.name: Herberth Yerman

texts.es:
Herberth, de 26 años de edad, está soltero, estudió hasta noveno grado. Aún vive en la misma casa donde su madre.

Herberth, se dedica a manejar un microbús de una institución de radio, ha estado desempeñando esta labor durante 5 años.- Herberth,  también se dedica a la agricultura en el tiempo que no está trabajando para la institución.  El lugar de trabajo está a 9 kilómetros de su hogar y su horario es de 8 horas al día. 

Herberth, necesita el crédito para comprar una motocicleta para trasladarse desde el trabajo hasta su casa, porque a veces sale tarde y el transporte hasta su casa es irregular.-
El préstamo le ayudará a tener un medio para trasladarse y llegar más seguro hasta su casa, ya que en ocasiones sale noche.
 
Herberth, sueña con darle mejores condiciones de vida a su madre y en un futuro formar su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Herberth is 26 years old and single. He studied up to Grade 9. He still lives in his mother's house. Herberth works driving a micro-bus for a radio station. He has been doing this work for 5 years. Herberth also works framing in the time he is not at work at the institution. His place of work is 9 km from his house and he works 8 hours per day.

Herberth needs a loan to buy a motorcycle to get to his house from work as sometimes he leaves work late and transport to his house is very irregular. The loan will help him have a way to get around and get home in a more sure way as at times he gets off work at night. Herberth dreams of providing the best living conditions for his mother and in the future have his own house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: José Raul

texts.es:
José, de 47 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos,  pero solo 2 viven con ellos y están estudiando, los demás tiene sus propios hogares. 

José, se dedica a trabajar en estructuras metálicas, haciendo puertas de hierro, ventanas entre otras cosas, realiza este trabajo desde hace 30 años, el oficio lo aprendió de un familiar.- Además de esta labor se dedica a la agricultura, el lugar donde cultiva está cerca de su casa, por lo que no se le dificulta llegar hasta ahí, en el trabajo agrícola se involucra uno de sus hijos.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar hierro, y una máquina para soldar. El préstamo le ayudará a cubrir la demanda en su trabajo, ya que es una persona muy conocida en su comunidad y le dan bastante trabajo.

Los sueños de José son, poner otro negocio en el municipio más cercano. Para su familia, sueña con que sus hijos puedan estudiar  para que tengan un trabajo mejor.
texts.en:
José, 47 years old, is partnered and has 4 children, but only 2 live with them and are students, the others have their own homes. 

José works with metal structures, making iron doors and windows among other things. He has done this work for 30 years, and learned the trade from a relative. In addition to this work, he works in agriculture. The place he cultivates is close to his house, so it is not difficult to get there. One of his sons is involved in the agricultural work.

The loan is needed to purchase iron and a welding machine. The loan will help him to meet the demand for his work, since he is a person very known in the community and they give him plenty of work. José's dream is to open another business in the closest municipality. For his family, he dreams of his children being able to go to school so that they have a better job.

loans.use: to purchase iron and a welding machine.

loans.name: Jose Arlen

texts.es:
Arlen es un caficultor orgánico certificado desde hace 10 años, convencido de que la agricultura orgánica vale la pena porque le permite tener una vida más saludable y amigable con  el medio ambiente. Él está casado y tiene dos hijos.
Arlen sueña con hacer un reservorio de  agua para mantener agua constante en sus cultivos, conservar las variedades de café tradicionales para garantizar una buena calidad y diversificar su finca sembrando frutales y cultivos de pan coger con los cuales pueda mejorar la alimentación  familiar, para lograr este sueño Arlen necesita un préstamo de  5.600.000. A nivel familiar quiere garantizar el estudio a sus hijos, adecuar una vivienda digna y obtener una buena  rentabilidad por sus cultivos  que le permita ser autosuficiente y  mostrarle a la gente de su comunidad otras alternativas.
texts.en:
Arlen is a coffee producer, certified organic for the past 10 years, convinced that organic agriculture is worth it because it allows him to have a healthier life, friendlier for the environment. He is married and has two children. 

Arlen dreams of having a reservoir of water to maintain a constant flow of water to his crops, to conserve the traditional varieties of coffee to guarantee good quality, and to diversify the farm planting fruit trees and grain crops with which he could improve his family's diet. To achieve this dream, Arlen needs a loan of 5.600.000 COP. At the family level, he wants to guarantee schooling for his children, provide a dignified home and get good profitability for his crops which would permit him to be self-sufficient and show people in his community other alternatives.

loans.use: to strengthen the production of organic coffee.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Isabel, a hardworking, very honest and warm-hearted farmer who hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Isabel is the proud mother of a lovely two-year-old whom she adores and always protects. 

Isabel’s upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming six years ago. Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income, becoming the breadwinner of her family; this really pushes her to work hard so that her child will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. 

Isabel is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticultural farming. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Isabel is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. 

Through the income from horticultural farming, Isabel will assure her children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 27-year-old woman, living with her family in a small house in Gaza. Currently, she has a business; raising and selling sheep. She started this trade five years ago, having learned this from her parents when she was child. 

She is currently asking for a loan because her house was damaged in the last war in Gaza so she wants to  buy building materials for renovating her home. The things that she wants to do are build the ceiling and walls as a start, then she would like to install doors and windows. This will allow her to get back into her house again and reunite her family to gather. Amal is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to  buy building materials for renovating her home, to build ceiling and walls as a start then install doors and windows.

loans.name: Zakarya

texts.en:
Zakarya is a 38-year-old who lives in Gaza with his wife and their four children. His wife is unemployed and the kids are completing their middle school studies. His house was affected by the last war in Gaza; two rooms were damaged and the effects of firing and shooting are all over the house.

The goal of the loan will be to buy construction tools, since these are important for him to mend the damages, and to be able pay workers; he wants to rebuild the kitchen, install windows, and paint the house.

One of his biggest dreams is to see his children grow and to give them an education so that they can become professionals. Zakarya is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to mend the damages and to be able pay for workers; specifically, he wants to rebuild the kitchen, install windows, and paint the house.

loans.name: Oysha

texts.en:
Oysha is a strong woman. Born in 1957, she lives in a rural area as a widow. She has no children. 

For about 21 years, Oysha has owned and operated a confectionery shop. Assisted by her sister, her business is well arranged and she has many clients. The activity is profitable. 

Oysha is requesting a loan to help buy candies, sugar etc. for her shop.

loans.use: To buy candies, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Para Que Vuelva Group

texts.es:
JESICA  tiene 30 años de edad – habita en Limones en  una pequeña vivienda con su esposo – 7 hijos – y 3 hijastros. Todos estudian. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca y le ayuda en la tienda en su tiempo libre. 
JESICA desde hace 1 año inicio su actividad comercial con una pequeña tienda; luego de tener por 4 años una pequeña boutique.
Con este segundo crédito ella comprara productos como “arroz – azúcar – aceites – pan – panela – pollo. Que son los productos que más se venden en el barrio.
Ella se considera muy sencilla amable y colaboradora - trabaja de una forma organizada con sus compañeros de grupo  en beneficio de su barrio y comunidad para lograr la convivencia en un ambiente sano y de paz.
JESICA forma parte del grupo “para que vuelvas”  formada por 10 mujeres muy organizadas responsables y trabajadoras.
JESICA tiene pensado en un corto tiempo tener un negocio más grande y bien surtido frescos y baratos  para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y amigos.
texts.en:
Jesica, age 30, lives in Limones in a small house with her husband, seven children, and three stepchildren.  All of them go to school.  Her husband is a fisherman, and he helps her in the store in his free time.

Jesica started her business activity, a small store, one year ago after having a small boutique for four years.

With this second loan she will buy products like rice, sugar, cooking oils, bread, brown sugar, and chicken.  These are the products that sell the most in her neighborhood.

She considers herself to be very unassuming, kind, and cooperative.  She works in an organized way with her colleagues in the group, which benefits her neighborhood and community, in order to manage to live together in a healthy and peaceful environment.

Jesica is part of the Para Que Vuelvas group.  It is comprised of ten very organized, responsible, and hard-working women.  Jesica plans to soon have a bigger business that is well stocked with fresh and inexpensive items to meet the needs of her customers and friends.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oils, bread, brown sugar, and chicken.

loans.name: Omar Rene

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo, el mismo cuenta con varios sitios de descanso que son muy visitados por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, como tradición tienen las fiestas del Cantón en las cuales se realizan bailes populares y la famosa quema del castillo, la gente en este Cantón es amable y tranquila con todos sus visitantes. 
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio el señor Omar un hombre luchador de 43 años es casado, su esposa no trabaja pasa en casa y le ayuda en el negocio, de esta relación tienen 1 hijo de 10 años el mismo que está estudiando en una escuela del sector.
El señor Omar tiene una cerrajería aprendió de esta actividad cuando tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar como ayudante en una cerrajería de un amigo, cuando ya aprendió lo necesario decidió iniciar por su cuenta en esta actividad, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 10 horas diarias. 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio, comprará materiales y arreglará el negocio, con esta inversión incrementara su trabajo y sus ingresos económicos, El señor Omar agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, the canton of love, is a canton with a warm humid climate, and has various restful places which are visited by many tourists, both domestic and international. As a tradition, they have the canton festivals where they do the traditional dances, and the famous burning of the castle. The people in this canton are friendly and peaceful with all their visitors. 

Omar lives and has his business in this canton. He is a determined man, 43 years old, married, and his wife doesn't work, she stays in the house and helps him in his business. From this relationship, he has one son who is 10 years old and is a student in a local school. 

Omar has a locksmith's shop; he learned this work when he had the opportunity to work as an assistant at a friend's locksmith shop. When he had learned everything necessary, he decided to start in this work on his own. He works an average of 10 hours daily in this business.

He asks for this loan to invest in his business. He will purchase materials and will fix up the business; with this investment, he will increase his work and his economic income. Omar is grateful to Fundación Alternative and to Kiva for the offered support and opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase materials and repairs for his shop, with this income he will realize his dream of being a successful micro-entrepreneur.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a businesswoman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of an 8-year-old child. Melanie runs a retail store selling dry goods and food items. This has been the source of her income for more than 8 years now. 

Melanie is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like clothes, pants, slippers and shoes, snack foods, and soft drinks. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stocks, thus attracting more buyers to her store.

In the future, Melanie hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 27 years old. He lives with his parents in Gaza, and works as accountant at private institution. Ahmad is asking Ryada for this loan to buy flagstones and building materials for renovating their home. He wants to help his family with this loan to improve the house after the last war at Gaza and make it better, which will enable them to live in more psychological comfort. He has a shortage in money to buy the things he needs and help his parents. 

He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy building materials for rebuilding his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Jeton

texts.en:
Jeton comes from the western part of Kosovo. He is a married father of 4 children who works a lot and very hard to provide his family with better living conditions and opportunities for a better future. Jeton has been doing construction work for many years, gaining experience from different companies and learning his trade well. For more than 5 years now, he has been doing freelance and contract construction work, building façades and painting different structures and buildings. His work ethic and quality have helped him to become well-known in the area and build a large customer base. 

For the first time, Jeton is requesting a loan in order to purchase new tools and construction supplies for his work. He is hopeful that these new tools will help him to work more efficiently and effectively, providing better products and services to his customers. He hopes that he will earn enough money to hire an employee this spring. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and construction supplies for building façades and painting

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 43 years old. He is married to Beatrice and blessed with five children between the ages of 4 to 22 years old. He has been buying and selling flowers for various occasions in his community for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Timothy has applied for his fifth loan of 10,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use the loan to buy more stocks of assorted flowers and flower vases for floral arrangements.

He will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and be stable in his business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of assorted flowers and flower vases

loans.name: Sevinc

texts.en:
Sevinc is 30 years old, a married woman with two children. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) who lives in Bilasuvar Region. She has a good family; her husband is a worker in a local bazaar.

Sevinc is a hard-working woman. She has been working for eight years in the agriculture sector. She grows vegetables and fruit trees in her garden.

It is real that her family is so poor. Her monthly income is 150 AZN.

That profit is not enough for her family. She needs a loan  to buy a small plot of land to grow more vegetables. Sevinc thinks this plan will change her life. She asking for a loan of 1000 AZN from Kiva. She hopes the lenders help her.

loans.use: to buy a small plot of land to grow more vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to stock her small store.

loans.name: Lamia Hezyaz Group

texts.en:
This group is called Lamia Hezyaz. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.
Madiha is the leader of the group. She is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. Her husband works as a solider with a small salary. 

Madiha decided to help him take care of the children's needs. She started sewing women's clothes in her house. She has few sewing materials and only one sewing machine. 

Madiha wants to enlarge her business to attract a lot of customers but she doesn't have enough equipment. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase sewing materials to expand her own business.

Madiha hopes to have a large sewing shop.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials to expand her own business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.en: Rukiya is a businesswoman who was born in 1938. She lives in a rural area, and she is a widow with four children. For the past 27 years, she has been working as a retailer, buying and selling fruits. She tries to sell high-quality produce. Rukiya believes that advertising is a half of a business. She has gotten more clients by doing her very best and and serving them promptly. Because she wants to enlarge her business, Rukiya needs financial support to buy fruits for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fruits for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man from Jabalia. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His father is a painter who gets an unstable income due to the low demand in the winter. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Mohammad is a student in a local university, where he studies business administration. He wants to complete his studies and take the BA degree to find a job and help his family with part of their expenses.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and write reports easily. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Ma. Hedelita

texts.en:
Ma. Hedelita earns a living by making and selling lumpia (fried spring rolls), also known as lumpiang gulay ("vegetable spring roll"). The dish consists of a briskly fried pancake filled with bean sprouts and various other vegetables such as string beans and carrots. Small morsels of meat, seafood, or tofu may be added. They are usually eaten with vinegar and chili peppers or a mixture of soy sauce and calamansi juice known as toyomansi.

Ma. Hedelita is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy supplies like vegetables, meat, seasonings, and other ingredients. These ingredients will be used in making lumpia, which she will sell in her local community. 

Ma. Hedelita is married and has six dependents, three of whom are still attending school. In the following months, Ma. Hedelita and her family will be experiencing changes in their earnings, and she can now afford to provide her children with nutritious diets and continue sending her children to school for brighter futures. She hopes that she can manage her business well.

loans.use: to buy supplies like vegetables, meat, seasonings, and other ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cement and bricks to renovate his house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Josephine has been involved in fishing for five years. This is the common livelihood for most people living in Carles, Iloilo, where she resides with her family. Josephine has worked hard with her husband to have a successful fishing business. She is asking a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fishing nets to replace their old ones.

She is hoping that, through a loan with Kiva and CEVI, she will be able to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 57 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.   

Veronica has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Veronica requested a 28,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Veronica has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Horacio

texts.es:
Jorge un estilista de 45 años de edad, actualmente separado de su esposa con quien tuvo 2 hijos de 16 y 15 años de edad. 
Su idea de negocio surgió apenas hace un año donde hubo una combinación de pasión y necesidad y desde ese momento opto por ser un estilista.
Jorge no quiere estancarse en un flujo de cliente común, quiere crecer y brindar una mejor estabilidad económica tanto para el como para su ex familia.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de 2 vitrinas, 4 estanterías y surtido de productos de peluquería.
Su principal objetivo a través del crédito es generar empleo y ser una empresa solida
texts.en:
Jorge is a 45-year-old stylist who is currently separated from his wife with whom he had two children, ages 15 and 16.
His business idea came about barely a year ago from a combination of passion and necessity. He decided to be a stylist.
Jorge does not want to stagnate with his current clientele; he wants to grow and provide better economic stability to himself and his ex family.
He is requesting a loan for the purchase of two display cases, 4 bookcases, and stock of hairdressing products.
His main goal with this loan is to generate employment and have a solid business.

loans.use: to buy two display cases, 4 stands and stock of hairdressing products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sheets, towels and awnings to sell, and to make the most of the Christmas season to increase sales and to stock up on these products on promotion.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials like wood for his carpentry workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement and wood to build extra rooms for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fish and resell them in the local market

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 61-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines, and the mother of five grown-up children. Myrna earns an income through her sari-sari or retail store business, where she sells various goods and items to the people of her community.

Myrna would like expand her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, condiments, sugar, salt, and cooking oil. This loan will help her to improve her stocks, thus potentially attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Myrna wants to expand her venture so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Skin Success Group

texts.en:
Khadija, who is in her late 20s, is married with one small kid. She has been selling fish for three years now. She works from 5 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Khadija's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to  increase the fish stock and meet her customers' demand. She dreams of building her own house.

Khadija will share this loan with her loan group, "Skin Success," which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the fish stock and meet her customers'  demand.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is 44 years old with one son, age 9. Aileen has been engaged in fishing for 13 years now. She is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy a new fishing net and boat engine to make her business more productive. An increase in her income will allow her to save, send her child to school and pay for nutritious meal that her family can enjoy. 

In the future, she will work harder in order to be successful and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net and boat engine

loans.name: Rafat

texts.en:
Rafat is a 29-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives alone in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Rafat would like to improve his living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Rafat took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar water-heating system and a tank. By taking this loan, Rafat will be able to provide hot water for his house without using electricity.

Rafat appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar water-heating system and a tank.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 34 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. Arlene has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gisseth Paola

texts.es: Gisseth, es una joven de 20 años, dedicada a su negocio de Ebanisteria desde el año 2012,que funciona en un barrio ubicado en Barranquilla, este negocio inicio en conjunto con su ex cónyuge, pero al momento de la separación él decidió cedérsela, ella contrató a su padre para que fuese el jefe de la ebanistería y ofreciera los servicios de elaboración de closets, consolas, juegos de comedor y muebles en general.  En su rol de madre responsable de su hijo y con apenas 1 año de edad, Gisseth desea brindarle una excelente educación y bienestar, su hijo es su principal motivación y para conseguir los recursos pertinentes a su sustento, ella trabaja con mucho esfuerzo 10 horas diarias.  Con la finalidad de tener beneficios económicos, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará madera, pegante, telas, forros y demás insumos para aprovisionarse y sacar a la venta nuevos y exclusivos diseños para la temporada decembrina. Una de las estrategia de su negocio, es la facilidad de pago  que brinda a sus clientes, así mismo el negocio se ha mantenido por la confianza que han depositado sus proveedores, al ofrecerle la mercancía a crédito aunque y al realizar  compras de contado, obtiene mejores precios.  Gisseth tiene como meta a futuro comprar su casa y fortalecer el capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Gisseth, age 20, has been working in the cabinetmaking business since the year 2012.  The business operates in a neighborhood in Barranquilla.  She started this business together with her ex-husband.  However, when they separated he decided to hand it over to her.  She hired her father to be the head of the cabinetmaking business and to provide his services making closets, side tables, dining room sets, and general furniture. 

She is the responsible mother of her son, who is just one year old.  Gisseth wishes to provide him with and excellent education and sense of well-being.  Her son is her primary motivation to get the resources needed to support him. 

She works with great effort ten hours a day.  She does this in order to make a living.
