She is requesting a Kiva loan, her first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy wood, glue, fabric, padding, and other supplies.  She will do this in order to have supplies and to sell new and exclusive designs during the holiday season. 

One of her business strategies is ease of payment that she provides for her customers.  This way the business has been maintained by the confidence that her providers have placed in her by selling the merchandise on credit even though the prices are better when paying cash.

Gesseth’s goal for the future if to buy a house and to strengthen her working capital.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue, fabric, padding, and other supplies

loans.name: Nurhayat

texts.en:
Nurhayat is married with two children. She has sold Amway for 2.5 years. She started using the products and, when she liked them, she began selling to her friends and relatives. She works to provide for her children’s education. She wants her daughters to have professions when they finish school. With her second loan, she’ll buy goods wholesale to sell.  [Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff]

Nurhayat hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  İki buçuk yıldır Amway   ürünleri satışı yapıyor.  Daha önce kullanıcısı olduğu ürünlerden memnun kalınca  çevresi ve akrabalarına satarak bu işe başlıyor.  Çocuklarının eğitim ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için bu işi yapıyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile toplu  ürün çekip satış yapacak.  Kızlarının okullarını bitirip birer iş sahibi olmalarını istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more Amway products for resale.

loans.name: Maria Grisely

texts.es:
María una humilde, pero trabajadora mujer de 52 años de edad, es cabeza de familia y vela por el cuidado de una niña de tan solo 13 años de edad, su amada hija a la cual puede darle un bocado de comida gracias a su negocio de venta de artículos como dulces, frituras en empaques, chocolates etc.
Su negocio ella sabe que no es la gran cosa, pero puede ganar su propio dinero honradamente.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido para abastecer su carro de mercancía variada entre dulces y bolsas de frituras. 
Su sueño es poder tener una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar ayúdala a acercarse a este sueño
texts.en:
María is a modest but hard working women who is 52 years old. She is the head of her family and looks after her daughter who is just 13 years old. She is able to give her beloved daughter a small amount of food thanks to her business of selling items such as sweets, packets of fried food, chocolates etc. 
She knows her business is nothing great, but she is able to earn her own money in an honest way. 
She is asking for a loan to buy an assortment to stock up her cart with various items such as sweets and bags of fried food. 
Her dream is to be able to have a shop to sell basic family products. Help her get closer to this dream.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of sweets and bags of fried food to stock her cart.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Evelyn is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Sor Angela

texts.es:
Sor una emprendedora, soñadora, capacitada mujer que se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino, una actividad que aprendió de sus padres y que decidió ejercer por iniciativa propia.
A sus 48 años de edad es casada y tiene un hijo mayor de edad y solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos en una considerable cantidad, parte del préstamo será destinado al cuidado y remodelación de las cocheras de los cerdos.
La urgencia del crédito es los cambios climáticos que estan acabando con su ganado al no tener unas cocheras bien adecuadas. 
Apoya a una mujer que no solo piensa como empresa, piensa en el cuidado de sus animales.
texts.en:
Sor is an enterprising, dreaming, well-trained woman who raises hogs. She learned this work from her parents and decided on her own to do the same work.
At the age of 48, she is married and has a grown child. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of a large quantity of hogs. She will use part of the loan to care for and remodel her pig pens.
The loan is urgent because of the weather changes that are killing her livestock because she does not have adequate pig pens.
Support a woman who isn't just thinking about her business, but who also thinks about the care of her animals.

loans.use: to purchase a significant quantity of hogs and to fit out her garage because the animals are dying due to the climate.

loans.name: Kairat

texts.en:
Kairat is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Software Engineering. Here is his story:

“My name is Kairat. My friends say that I am a very ambitious person. I want to get a bachelor's degree at AUCA and a master's at M.I.T. or at Stanford and work at Google in the future.

"I will do my best to make my dreams a reality. To accomplish my aims I want to study at AUCA because I will have more opportunities to gain the necessary knowledge to work for the best companies in the world. A great example for me is Tilek Mamutov, a 2005 AUCA graduate, who works as a manager of the Loon Project at Google. I wish to work for a great company like Google and invent something new to the world.

"Neither of my parents had the chance to get a higher education, so they tried to do everything to raise a love of study in us and to help us understand the importance of hard work and dedication. Because of their love and sacrifice over the years, I have been able to devote the time and energy to academic accomplishments even though money has always been tight. I took part in the Olympiad of Informatics in the city and in our region. I practiced as an informatics tutor with elementary school students and was active outside the classroom. I used to organize computer competitions with like-minded students and worked as a Finance Minister in our school parliament. In high school I had a 4.0 GPA (out of 4.0), and I became one of the three top graduates."

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase different kinds of food to resell to children in the schools.

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en:
Arwa is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children, living with her family in miserable conditions in Taiz city, Yemen. Arwa is a university graduate and her husband is an employee in the private sector with a small salary. Arwa couldn't find a job to help him cover the expenses of the family. 

The house where Arwa lives with her family lacks of a lot of furniture. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is very limited and not enough to furnish his house. For this reason, Arwa applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some furniture for the house.

Arwa dreams of purchasing a new house and furnishing it with furniture and home appliances.

loans.use: To purchase some furniture for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cement and bricks to renovate his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old single man who has worked in the construction field, specializing in wall painting, since three years ago to cover the needs and expenses of his family that consists of three members.

Ali is an ambitious man and a hard worker who gained painting experience from his elder brother, and now he is trying hard to develop his business by providing his customers with special decorations. 

Today, Ali is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy compressors, which will facilitate his business and allow him to provide his customers with better and quick service.

Ali hopes to own a painting shop in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy compressors necessary for his wall-painting business to provide his customers with better service

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 56 years old and a married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Angelina has a firewood sales business in the Philippines. Angelina requested a 29,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more firewood to sell.

Angelina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Preciosa

texts.en:
Preciosa is 56 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Preciosa has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Preciosa requested a 26,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Preciosa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Preciosa would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Hayriniso

texts.en:
Hayriniso is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1966 in a rural area. She lives in a village. She is married. She is an active, honest, exemplary, thrifty person.  

Hayriniso and her husband are working in the ground, planting seeds. Besides this, she feeds her livestock with her planting and sells cattle in local markets. She gains income from each sold head of cattle. Her income expends for the benefit of her family. 

She needs financial support in order to buy a heater, coal and other things for preparing the house for winter. She wants to be adapted to winter’s fluctuations. She is planning to build a place for keeping livestock from the income of her activity next year.

loans.use: To buy a heater, coal and other things for preparing the house for winter

loans.name: Tushikamane Mbweni Group

texts.en:
Sofia, who is in her early 50s, is single with seven children, two of whom are still in school and five of whom are grown-ups. Sofia has been selling sarongs, fabrics and madelas for one and half years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Sofia's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to start selling madelas and increased her stock of sarongs and fabrics to sell door to door. She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more sarongs, fabrics and madelas to resell. She dreams of having a big stock of her projects.

Sofia will share this loan with her loan group Tushikamane Mbweni, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sarongs, fabrics and madelas to resell.

loans.name: Mary Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mary una emprendedora mujer de 53 años de edad propietaria de un lava autos donde cuenta con un empleado, es madre de 3 hijos que son su mayor preocupación y prioridad, pero sin descuidar su negocio en el que trata de tener la mejor maquinaria disponible para dejar satisfechos a sus clientes, pues sabe que muchos son muy apegados a ellos e incluso los tratan como un hijo.
Por tal razón Mary quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de tres aspiradoras para cumplir diferentes funciones y ampliar su capacidad de lavado.
Este crédito le podrá ayudar atraer un mayor número de clientes al saber la maquinaria que maneja en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mary, an enterprising woman of 53 years, owns a carwash where she has one employee. She is a mother of three children who are her greatest preoccupation and priority, but she still takes care of her business as well. She tries to have the best machinery available in order to keep her customers satisfied. She knows that many are very devoted to it and she treats them as if they were her children.
For this reason, Mary wants to take out a loan for the purchase of three vacuum cleaners to complete various functions and expand her capacity. This loan could help her to attract a greater number of clients when they know the kind of machinery she has in her business.

loans.use: to buy three vacuum cleaners in order to provide a more optimal service in her car-washing business.

loans.name: Francy Milena

texts.es:
Francy una mujer de 28 años de edad que lucha por sus sueños y metas tal y como se lo enseñaron hacer sus padres siempre dando lo mejor de ella para cumplir sus objetivos.
Es madre soltera de dos hijos de 3 y 8 años de edad y logra generar el sustento gracias a sus confecciones donde realiza diseños novedosos y por encargo.
Para mejorar su empresa necesita una maquina plana, hilos y pega por ello solicita un crédito para comprar dichos implementos que son tan importantes en su actividad y que le permitirán tener mejor rentabilidad que piensa usar para iniciar a estudiar y profesionalizarse.
texts.en:
Francy is a 28-year-old woman who fights for her dreams and goals as her parents taught her, always giving the best of herself in order to achieve her aims.
She is a single mother of two children who are 3 and 8 years old. She manages to create support thanks to her sewing where she makes original designs and also designs on request.
To improve her business she needs a tabletop sewing machine, threads and glue and for this she is asking for a loan to buy these tools which are so important in her activity and that will allow her to improve her profits which she is thinking of using to start studying and to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine, thread and glue to optimize and improve her production as she wants to study.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en: Shoira is a hard-working woman. She was born in a rural area. She lives in a small town. She is married and has three children. About 10 years ago, she began working in the agricultural sphere. She plants seeds and vegetables. She plants and sells barley, cucumbers and onions. She has a friendly family. Shoira and her husband are the keepers of their family. She wants to increase her business. Shoira is planning to buy livestock. She needs financial support to do business.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man from Beddya, a village near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. Three years ago, Mohammad started working as an electrician. He gets a good income but it is not stable due to the unstable demand. He would like to gain more experience and expand his business in the future. Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more supplies like wires and repair parts for his work. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his productivity. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like wires and repair parts for his work.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a dressmaker from Iloilo, Philippines. She is a 60-year-old widow and has two dependents. Lydia has been in the dressmaking business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Lydia is asking for a loan to buy more cloth or textiles, thread, needles and scissors. With a loan, she will be able to improve her materials. thus allowing her to cater to more customers in her shop. In the future, Lydia hopes to improve the sustainability and productivity of her business.

loans.use: to buy more cloth or textiles, thread, needles and scissors

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos es un orgulloso trabajador, se desempeña como el tendero tradicional del barrio en un negocio que heredó de su padre y que aprendió yendo a trabajar esporádicamente ayudándolo.
Carlos es padre de 4 hijas todas ellas menores de edad vela por su futuro y puede generar los recursos suficientes gracias a su tienda.
En su futuro están muchos proyectos todos ellos giran alrededor de sus hijas quiere que tengan una buena calidad de vida y puedan acceder al estudio por ello solo le queda impulsar y sacar adelante su negocio.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de refrescos, cervezas, granos y abarrotes con la ayuda de este crédito abasteceré su negocio, teniendo surtido suficiente para atender la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is a proud worker, he is a traditional shopkeeper in his neighborhood, a business inherited from his father and which he learned while helping his father from time to time. Carlos is the father of 4 daughters all under age. He looks after their future and can generate enough resources thanks to his shop. For the future he has many projects, all of which are related to his daughters. He wants them to have a good quality of life and to have an education. This is why he needs to boost and get his business ahead.

He asks for a loan to buy soft drinks, beers, grains and groceries. With the help of this loan he will be able to stock his shop and have enough variety to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of soft drinks, beers, grains to stock his shop.

loans.name: Zade

texts.en:
Zade wants to thank all of the lenders for their support. The loan that she was given was used to repair and renovate her home. She was very happy and satisfied with the loan process and with the results. Since the home has been repaired she has started to do handicraft business from her home. Now, she is again asking for a loan, but this time it’s for her business, to buy material.

She would like to be able to purchase material to provide better products and variety to her clients. She hopes that she will be able to hire an employee and expand her business even further. She really appreciates this help and wants to thank all of the lenders for their continued support in helping her to generate income.

loans.use: to buy material.

loans.name: Deysy Lorena

texts.es:
Deisy una hermosa flor de 25 años de edad que lleva en sus venas las confecciones pues sus antepasadas se dedicaba a dicha actividad.
SU mayor sueño es sacar a delante su matrimonio y su aporte al hogar lo hace gracias a sus confecciones que realiza a terceros, pero ella sabe que puede dar más innovar el mercado sacando una línea propia de confección y por ello solicita un crédito para impulsar su idea con la que comprara telas, hilos para la creación de su línea propia de uniformes.
Sueña con tener un exitoso trabajo y una hermosa familia.
texts.en:
Deisy is a beautiful 25 year old girl who carries sewing in her blood since her ancestors worked in this field.  Her greatest desire is to help her marriage and her household move forward. She is doing that thanks to her sewing, which she completes for third parties.  However, she knows that she could bring more innovation to the market by starting her own sewing line and for this she is requesting a loan.  She will use it to buy fabric and thread for the making of her own line of uniforms. 

She dreams of having success in her work and of having a beautiful family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread for starting her own line of clothing for uniforms.

loans.name: Talatu

texts.en: Talatu is a maize farmer from Dogon Fako village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Talatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Talatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Talatu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to purchase storage for her crops.

loans.name: Naseema

texts.en:
Naseema, age 60, is a married woman with two children.  The son, shown in the photo, started a van driving business 5 years ago. He owns one Suzuki van and needs some financial help to repair and maintain the van.  Naseema requests 30,000 PKR from Murabaha for her son to purchase new tires and  spare parts. 

She is hopeful that her son’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old married Palestinian man who has worked in transporting students with his bus for five years. He is working hard to improve his family's living conditions and cover their increasing needs. 

Today, Mohammad is acquiring a YOUTH loan to repair his bus, which is his only source of income. He hopes to develop his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his bus, which is his only source of income

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a married man with 2 children who are 3 and 6 years old. He is focused and determined. He operates a retail business to make and sell handbags. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are retailers and wholesalers. 

He will use 30,000 KES to buy more material. His business goal is to have a retail shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy materials to make handbags.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a widowed woman with 2 children. She operates a retail business to sell fish (omena type) and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in an urban area and she has regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

She will use 15,000 KES to buy  fish. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Andrea Felina

texts.es:
Andrea, de 61 años de edad, está casada, estudió hasta sexto grado, ella creció con sus padres.-
Se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio de frutas; dicho trabajo lo realiza junto a su familia la cual esta conformada  por sus nietos y su esposo quienes le ayudan en la siembra. 

Andrea, se dedica a comercializar frutas de temporada como aguacate, nísperos, mangos, etc. Y además siembra maíz y frijol junto a su esposo en una parcela que alquila, tiene varios años de dedicarse a estas actividad.    

Andrea, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lamina, clavos y cuartones de madera, para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que se dañó con el invierno y con el paso del tiempo.- 

Andrea, en un fututo desea comprar una vaca e iniciar una producción de leche para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Andrea is 61 years old, married, went to school until the sixth grade and grew up with her parents. She makes a living in agriculture and selling fruits. She works with her family and the ones who help her with the crops are her grandchildren and her husband. Andrea sells seasonal fruits such as avocados, loquat, mangos, etc. She also grows corn and beans with her husband in a rented lot. She has been doing this type of work for various years.

Andrea needs the loan to buy materials such as sheeting, nails and wood beams to replace the roof of their home which was damaged by the winter and over time. 

In the future, Andrea would like to buy a cow to start milk production and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy materials such as sheeting, nails and wood beams to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en: Saeeda is 34 years of age. Her great skill in machine embroidery and an experience of 6 years in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over the time, the demand for her hand-embroidered cloth has grown and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her 4 children. Now, she has availed Murabaha of 35,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper. She hopes that her skill will help in providing for her family’s health expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be humble and faithful. 

Lilian operates a tailoring shop where she makes decorated clothes for covering sofa sets and tables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to open another business branch within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Khatiban

texts.en:
Khatiban Unnisa is a 57-year-old married woman who sells clothing. She purchases clothes of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in her town. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She requests 25,000 PKR from Murabaha to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Trinath Thakur Shg Group

texts.en:
Gitanjali is better known as Gita. She is married and 37 years old. She works selling popular food items in her house, starting at 6:30 p.m. and finishing when the last customer leaves and the food is gone.

Her main motivation for continuing in her business is her mother who started the business more than 30 years ago, selling bada, idli, samosa and upma (Odisha's traditional food items); later, she sold a larger variety of popular south Indian foods. Since she was little, Gitanjali and her three siblings helped their mother by tending to customers. "I remember when my mother was selling downtown and my older sister was the one who took care of us." Admiration and respect are what Gitanjali has for the two role models that she has in her life.

Since she was 10 years old, Gitanjali has worked selling bada, idli, samosa and upma, using her mother's recipes. She sets up her stand under a roof that they have established and puts out a large table where she prepares the food. 

Gitanjali uses the earnings she obtains to contribute to the household expenses, and to reinvest in the purchase of ingredients and supplies for her business. Gitanjali needs to stock up on more ingredients like chiles, onions, Maida, cream, beans, oil, flour, toothpicks, and gas, as sales increase with the start of the winter season. She wants to get ready to satisfy the needs of her customers, who come to her to buy because of the good flavors that she has. 

Every day, Gitanjali thanks God for the great family that He has given her, as now her husband is currently helping her out with her business. She also says that she feels very lucky to have her parents and to take care of them, as they did for her early on.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like chiles, onions, Maida, cream, beans, oil, flour, toothpicks, and gas.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with 7 children. She describes herself as honest and operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a secure convenient place and she has regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the rainy season which affects business. 

She will use 40,000 KES to buy ingredients to prepare food. Her business goal is to expand to a modern hotel within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was  successfully repaid. 

She will use the anticipated profits to open more business branches.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adamu would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Adamu is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Harisu

texts.en: Harisu is a maize farmer from Marmara village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Harisu would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Harisu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Harisu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tukur

texts.en: Tukur is a maize farmer from Katsalle village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Tukur would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Tukur can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Tukur, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Minara

texts.en:
Minara is a 57-year-old married woman with four beautiful kids. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar. She has a nice garden. Minara loves her garden. She grows fruits and vegetables. She has good experience in the agriculture  sector.

She enjoys when she  sells her crops in the bazaar. She earns 120 manat from this business. This money is not enough for her. For this reason she wants to buy a little land to grow a lot of fruits. She requests 1200 AZN from Kiva. This her first loan.

loans.use: to buy a little land to grow a lot of fruits

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as patient. She operates a beauty salon to offer beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and she has regular customers. 

She will use 10,000 KES to buy hair weaves and other salon supplies. Her business goal is to open another business branch within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves and other salon supplies.

loans.name: Denmark

texts.en:
Denmark is a fisherman who has been fishing for six years  to provide for himself and help his parents. He also operates a Sari-sari store. He works hard in order to save money. He hopes to have a big family someday. 

Denmark is asking for a loan to buy coffee, milk, detergent, shampoo, bath soap, chips, and candies. In the future, Denmark would like to have another source of income while sustaining his fishing operation and making it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, coffee, milk, detergent, shampoo, bath soap, chips, and candies

loans.name: Nanije

texts.en:
Nanije comes from the Roma community. She has three children between the ages of one and ten years old and is very fortunate that she has been able to earn a living working from home, making and selling handicrafts. Typically, she works for wedding celebrations and for the soon-to-be brides preparing for their upcoming weddings. This business is very popular and helps her to generate a decent enough income to be able to contribute to her family’s budget. She really loves what she does and has been in business for more than 14 years now. While Nanije is busy with her business and taking care of the children and the home, her husband is a musician who performs for wedding and other celebrations and events. Between both of their work being centered around weddings and other celebrations, they are very busy in the popular summer months and have to save money for the slow winter season. 

Nanije is requesting a loan for the first time in order to purchase materials for her handicraft business and get things ready for when the busy season starts. She hopes that this loan will help her to continue her business and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her handicraft business and get things ready for when the busy season starts.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 6 years to 13 years. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells tires. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough working capital. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tires. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of timber and firewood

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a married man with 2 children. He operates a retail business to sell popcorn. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are school children. He describes his biggest business challenge as mechanical breakdown of equipment. 

He will use 40,000 KES to buy corn and repair the popcorn machine. His business goal is to open another business branch within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. HIs previous loan was  successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy corn and repair the popcorn machine.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 27-year-old married woman and mother of 3 children. Her husband (also shown in the photo), ten years ago, started a van driving business. Her husband owns one Suzuki van and needs some financial help as he needs to get repair and maintenance work on the van. Therefore, Saima has availed Murabaha of 30,000 PKR for her husband. It helped him in purchasing new tires along with some spare parts for providing better customers’ facilities. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to purchase new tires along with some spare parts to improve her husband's van.

loans.name: Abubakar Alh.

texts.en:
Abubakar Alh. is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abubakar Alh. would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abubakar Alh. can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Abubakar Alh. is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his children Saidu, Shafi'U and Kamalu are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 45-year-old married woman. She has four children. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchasing for many years. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. 

Her business is providing her with enough income to support her family. However, she needs to earn much more to meet her children's expenditures. For this reason she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to buy more baby goats and calves for resale purposes to bear her children’s expenses efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats and calves for resale purposes to bear her children’s expenses efficiently.

loans.name: Quinter

texts.en:
Quinter is 30 years old. She is married to Peter and blessed with four children aged between 12 and three years respectively. She has been selling fresh milk to her customers and she has done this for the past two years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 15,000.

Quinter has requested for her first loan of Kshs. 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy more fresh milk from farmers for sale during this festive season. 


Her hopes and dreams for the future is to grow her business and buy a plot of land and build her house.

loans.use: to buy more fresh milk from farmers.

loans.name: Mamman Zaka

texts.en: Mamman Zaka is a maize farmer from Lumu village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Mamman Zaka would have to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to provide for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mamman Zaka can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Mamman Zaka, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 41-year-old married woman. She has seven children. For the past 15 years, she has been running a business of cattle sale and purchase along with her husband. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand their earnings, Naseem has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR to buy cattle for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale purposes.

loans.name: Ishaku Ranau

texts.en: Ishaku Ranau is a maize farmer from Dogon Fako village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ishaku Ranau would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ishaku Ranau can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ishaku Ranau, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Hồng

texts.en:
Hồng is 36 years old, and he is married with one child. He lives and works in Dong Son District, a rural area in Thanh Hoá province. Mr. Hồng works in agriculture, farming food. Hồng has been involved in this business for seven years.

In 2013, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his business. Hồng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

The main hardship that Hồng faces in his life is not having a clean water system. He is requesting a loan to purchase a water tank and install a clean water system.

With his business profit, Hồng hopes to remodel his house, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and install a clean water system

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is a married woman with one child. For the past three years, she has operated a boutique where she sells curtains and bed sheets. Milkah’s primary customers are locals and her biggest business challenge is the lack of working capital.

Milkah is requesting a 75,000 KES loan to buy more stock of curtains. This will be her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Milkah repaid her previous loans successfully. Her business goal is to be an international supplier of curtains and bed sheets within five years. Milkah hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy land and build a residential house.

loans.use: buy more curtains to sell

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a married man with children ages four and eight. He operates a retail business where he sells clothing. Joshua’s business is located in a busy shopping center and his primary customers are locals. He describes himself to be focused and determined. Joshua’s biggest business challenge is the rainy season which affects his business. This will be Joshua’s fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. He successfully repaid his previous loans. 

Joshua is requesting a 90,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothing to sell during the December peak season. His business goal is to have another clothing store within five years. Joshua hopes to have a good life in the future and he will use the anticipated profit from his loan to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell during the peak season

loans.name: Nicolás De Jesús

texts.es: Nicolás, residenciado en un barrio de Barranquilla, emprendió su negocio de ebanistería  en el año 1994, él aprendió este arte en el taller donde trabajaba como pintor automotriz, con solo observar los trabajos que un ebanista realizaba en ese mismo taller, aprendió y poco a poco continuó practicando hasta que se dedico completamente a esta actividad.  El fabrica muebles para sala, closet, consolas, multimuebles y hasta faroles para la navidad.  Su horario de atención es de 8:00 a.m.  a  5:00 p.m. y ofrece sus productos en exhibición donde los comercializa de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materia prima como madera, pegamento, pintura, puntillas, tornillos, telas para tapizado e invertirá en la compra de unos artículos de ferretería, él es un hombre entusiasta y emprendedor,  a futuro desea colocar un almacén ferretero.  Nicolás tiene 57 años de edad y una experiencia en el campo de 40 años, su meta familiar es ofrecerles estudios a sus hijos hasta donde ellos deseen seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Nicolás, who lives in a neighborhood of Barranquilla, began his furniture-making business in 1994. He learned this art in a shop where he worked painting cars. He learned just by observing the jobs that a furniture maker did in that same shop, and, little by little, he continued practicing until he began to work exclusively in that field. 

He manufactures livingroom furniture, armoires, consoles, entertainment centers, and even Christmas lanterns. His hours are 8:00 a.m. to  5:00 p.m. and he displays his products and sells them for cash. Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that he has requested of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, by means of which he will buy raw materials, such as wood, glue, paint, tacks, screws, upholstery fabric and he will invest in the purchase of several hardware items. 

He is an enthusiastic and enterprising man. In the future, he would like to open a hardware store. Nicolás is 57 years old and has 40 years of experience in this field. His family goal is to offer his children schooling as long as they want to continue studying.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, such as wood, glue, paint, tacks, screws, upholstery fabric and to invest in the purchase of several hardware items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en: Gordon is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area good for business, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to own a tuktuk within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a widowed woman with seven children. For the past 20 years, she has sold chickens. Annah’s business is located in an area that is good for business and her primary customers are the general public. She describes herself to be good. Annah describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances and increased pests. 

Annah is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy materials to improve her chicken housing. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: buy materials to improve her chicken housing

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is a Kiva borrower. He has three children with ages ranging from two to eight years. He describes himself to be reliable, and operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, beverages, flour and other items. He also runs M-pesa business within the shop. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an area with high customer inflow and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough working capital. He will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years, and he hopes that in the future, he will be self sustainable. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en: For the third time, Bajram is asking for a loan. He is very thankful and very pleased with the Kiva lenders supporting and helping him realize his dream over and over again. This time, Bajram is requesting a loan in order to purchase a cow to start a business selling milk and other dairy products in his neighborhood. He hopes that this will help him to continue to improve his family’s living situation and status, as they are from a vulnerable community with substandard living conditions. He is very happy to have the support and opportunity from the lenders and knows that without their help he would not be able to start this business. He hopes that this new investment will help him to be able to generate a much bigger and better income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to start a business selling milk and other dairy products in his neighborhood.

loans.name: Azhara

texts.en: Azhara, age 47, is a married woman. Four years ago, she decided to support her family by starting to stitch clothes at her home. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has an income that is barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Azhara is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she faces difficulty in covering daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has availed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine along with threads, buttons and laces to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine along with threads, buttons and laces to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Rosa Regina

texts.es:
Rosa  de 62 años de edad, originaria de la Managua  casada con tres hijos  mayores de edad, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente no pudo estudiar y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para sacar adelante  a  su familia.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante  tiene por actividad económica la una pulularía ubicado en su casa de habitación. El negocio consiste en vender productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, aceite, jabón. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio  en la compra de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Rosa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Rosa is 62 years old, originally from Managua and is married, with 3 adult children. She is noted for being hard-working and responsible, with a desire to improve herself. Sadly, she was not able to study and she had to work to help her family get ahead. 

Thanks to her desire to succeed, she has a convenience store business in her home. The business consists of selling food products in small amounts, such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs and oil, as well as detergent and soap. She works at her business about 12 hours a day, offering her products. 

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and supply her business by buying food products, so that in the very near future, she can obtain an increase in her income. Rosa is grateful for the assistance Kiva investors are providing to low income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua, so people can have a means of working with dignity.

loans.use: To invest in food products for her convenience store, such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, and oil, as well as detergent and soap.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 42 years old and engages in fishing. She also owns a Sari-sari store. She has seven children and two are still dependent at ages 16 and 19. Wilma is asking for a loan to buy a pressurized paraffin lamp (Petromax), and merchandise such as noodles, eggs, soy sauce, canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar, biscuits and candies. She is determined to keep and expand her business because this is the only livelihood she knows best. In the future, she hopes to further expand her business and make it more successful.

loans.use: to buy pressurized paraffin lamp (Petromax), and merchandise such as noodles, eggs, soy sauce, canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar, biscuits and candies.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Samaila is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family. He hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices directly after harvest

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be capable. He is a mechanic and he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy motor vehicle spare parts and repair tools. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts and repair tools

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be capable and promising. She operates a farm where she grows collard greens, potatoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase production. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She also own a restaurant. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of handbags and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of washing soap, sugar, flour and items he sells

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, cooking fat, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, cooking fat, rice and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, cooking fat, rice and other items

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a married man, and he has two children. He describes himself to be faithful. He operates a business transporting customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area good for business and his customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high fuel prices. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life and business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Ya'u

texts.en:
Ya'u is a maize farmer from Pampaida Makaranta village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ya'u would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ya'u can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Ya'u, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar junto a su padre y hermanas en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería, comercio de ganado, etc.

El se dedica a la venta de pollo, el mismo que distribuye a diferentes tiendas y bodegas pequeñas del distrito. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el producto es muy comercial en la zona y se vende de manera diaria. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de pollo para aumentar el stock de su negocio, lo que le permitirá aumentar su cantidad de clientes y por ende mejorará su nivel de ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 43 years old. He lives in the family house with his father and sisters in the district of La Matanza, Morropón province, Piura region on the North Coast of Peru. Life in this district passes quietly, it's inhabitants work in agriculture, raising and trading in livestock.

Wilfredo works selling chickens. He distributes them to various stores and supermarkets in the district. The market looks good as the product is in demand in the area and it sells every day. He has experience in the field and has very good personal and labor references in the district. The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of chickens to increase his stock for his business. This will permit him to increase his number of clients and in the end his level of income and his quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of chickens to increase the stock of his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber for making furniture

loans.name: Lissette Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Lissette del Socorro, es madre soltera de dos hijas de los cuales ambos estan bajo su tutela, es comerciante desde hace 15 años en unos de los mercados de la ciudad de León, donde su negocio principal es la venta  de chicha siendo este un delicioso cereal extraído del maíz y listo para ser preparado en refresco. Se dedica por la tarde a la elaboración y en la mañana se traslada al mercado para su comercialización  al por mayor y al detalle, a la vez se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella realiza estas labores para el sustento de su hogar.

Doña Lissette solicitó un crédito a Ceprodel el cual fue utilizado para comprar pantalones para ambos sexos, camisas, trajes de niños y ropa interior para ambos sexos y así obtener mayores ganancias, esto le ha permitido mejorar su nivel de vida al igual que el de sus dos hijas.
texts.en:
Lissette is a single mother of two girls, who are both taught by her. She has been a businesswoman for 15 years in some of the markets of the city of León,where her main business is the sale of chicha. This is a delicious cereal extracted from maize and ready to be prepared as a drink. She makes it in the afternoons and in the morning she goes to the market to sell wholesale and retail. She also sells clothes, and she does all this work to support her household.

Lissette asked for a loan from Ceprodel which was used to buy trousers for men and women, blouses, children's outfits and underwear for both sexes, and in this way make more profits, This has allowed her to improve her standard of living as well as that of her two daughters.

loans.use: to buy trousers for men and women, blouses, children's outfits and underwear for both sexes

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious and committed. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy hair chemicals and hair weaves. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and hair weaves

loans.name: Dzapargul

texts.ru: Джапаргуль, 44 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она 20 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 16,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Джапаргуль на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 1 бычок, 1теленок, 1 лошадь, 10 овец, также 3,0 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 8,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Джапаргуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и благоустройство дома.
texts.en:
Dzapargul is 44 and married with three children. She started working in animal husbandry and agriculture 20 years ago with 16,000 KGS as the primary source of income for her family. She currently has two cows, one steer, one calf, one horse and 10 sheep on her farm as well as 3 hectares of her own land where she grows barley. Her monthly income is about 8,800 KGS. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Dzapargul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase two dairy cows to increase the amount of organic milk she can sell. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her farm and doing landscaping around her home.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows in order to increase volume of organic milk sales

loans.name: Mairamgul

texts.ru: Майрамгул, 39 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У Майрамгул среднее образование, с 2004 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 1 лошадь и 10 овец. На участке мерою 7,0 ГА она выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Майрамгул известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Майрамгул планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Mairamgul is 39 and married with two children. She has a high school education and has been working in farming since 2004 as an additional source of income. She currently has three cows, one horse and 10 sheep, as well as 7 hectares of land where she grows clover for her own use and for sale. Mairamgul is known as a principled, honest, decent and kind person. Her business currently brings in a monthly income of 25,000 KGS.

In order to further develop her farm, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase 20 sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mathew would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mathew can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Mathew is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Javeria

texts.en:
Javeria is a 30-year-old married woman and mother of two children. Her husband (also shown in the photo), four years ago started a van driving business. Her husband owns one Suzuki van and needs some financial help, as he needs to get repair and maintenance work done on the van. 

Therefore, Javeria has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband. It helped him in purchasing new tires along with some spare parts for providing better customer service. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to purchase new tires along with some spare parts for providing better customer service

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps poultry. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more chickens. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman who has 4 children. She describes herself as capable.

She operates a retail shop where she sells soap, flour, bread, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient capital. She will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items. This will enable her to have enough stock of items to sell.

Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her family's living standards and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: Ibrahim Dan'asabe

texts.en:
Ibrahim Dan'asabe is a maize farmer.

Before he became a member of Babban Gona, Ibrahim Dan'asabe would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to address his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim Dan'Asabe can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Like other Babban Gona members, Ibrahim Dan'asabe is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy necessary food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure for him to sell his corn at low prices during harvest

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA GENERACION III, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Juana  tiene 53 años de edad  es soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna su actividades diarias con el negocio de confección de prendas de vestir, la socia confecciona diferentes tipos de fladas, ternos, camisas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, tijeras entre otros.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank “Nueva Generación III,” located in the Cusco province. She is 53 years old, single, and has a child. Besides her daily activities, she makes clothes such as skirts, three-piece suits, and shirts for customers that order them. She would like to be able to continue working in order to get ahead.

Juana is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, scissors and other items. She appreciates the loan and promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, scissors and other items for her business.

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
Dalila tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como sustento principal.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, chicha de jora (bebida tradicional de la región) y adicionalmente a la crianza de aves de corral (pollos, pavos, patos). Cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de muebles como mesas, sillas, materiales de cocina, entre otros para su negocio, con esto Dalila espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ingresos, aumentando así su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Dalila is 29 years old. She is married and lives in her own house with her husband in the district of La Matanza, Morropón province, Piura region on the North Coast of Peru. Life in this district passes quietly, it's inhabitants work in agriculture, raising and trading in livestock.

She works selling beer and corn chicha (a traditional drink of the region) and also raises poultry (chickens, ducks and turkeys). She has more than 5 years of experience in the field and has very good personal and labor references in the district. The loan will be used to buy furniture like tables and chairs, cooking materials amongst other things for her business. Doing this Dalila hopes to provide better service to her clients which will be reflected in her level of income increasing her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy furniture like tables, chairs, cooking materials and other things for her business.

loans.name: Gulbarkan

texts.ru: Гульбаркан, 25 лет, не замужем, есть 5 летняя дочь. Гульбаркан работает в кафе, также в 2009 году она начала бизнес по разведению скота и полеводству. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 8 овец, заготовлен корм и сено для скота. На участке мерою 2,05 Га она выращивает арбузы и хлопчатник для реализации. Совокупный среднемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь Гульбаркан и ее дочери, а так как сельское хозяйство - хороший источник дохода, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Гульбаркан является одним из трех членов группы "Асема". Доходы от кредита позволят Гульбаркан развить бизнес и улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en:
Gulbarkan is 25 years old, is not married, and has a 5-year-old daughter. Gulbarkan works in a cafe, and also in 2009 she started a business breeding livestock and raising crops. Currently on her homestead, she has eight sheep, harvested feed and hay for the livestock. On a plot of land measuring 2.05 hectares, she grows watermelons and cotton plants for sale. Total average income amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS). These funds are sorely lacking for a decent life for Gulbarkan and her daughter, but since agriculture is a good source of income, she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. Gulbarkan is one of the three members of the "Asema" loan group.

Income from the loan will allow Gulbarkan to develop the business and to improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to help bolster her family's income.

loans.name: Fazilamo

texts.ru: Фазиламо является растниеводом из района Фархор. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем за фермера и у них двое сыновей и двое дочерей. Фазиламо вместе с мужем на большом участке земли занимается растениеводством. На протяжении 5 лет они выращивают зерновые и огородные культуры. Это единственный источник дохода семьи. Фазиламо сейчас с мужем собираются провести зимний посев. Для этого они просят кредит, чтобы приобрести семена пшеницы и топлива. Фазиламо планирует собрать богатый урожай пшеницы и получить хорошую прибыль от его продаж, что позволит ей улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Fazilamo is a farmer from the Farhor region. She is 29 and married to a farmer; they have two sons and two daughters. She and her husband work in agriculture on a large piece of land. For five years they have been growing grains and vegetables as the sole source of income for their family.

Fazilamo and her husband are preparing for the winter sowing. For this reason they are requesting a loan to buy wheat seed and fuel. She plans to bring in a rich wheat harvest and receive a good profit from its sale, which will allow her to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed and fuel

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Шахноза проживает в городе Душанбе. Она замужем и вместе с мужем растет двухлетнего сына. Муж предоставляет услуги таксиста. Шахноза работает портнихой в одном из ателье города. Шахноза начала эту деятельность 4 года назад. Ее научила шить тетя. Шахноза по сей день благодарна ей. 
  Причина, по которой Шахноза обратилась за кредитом, является купля стиральной машинки. Она не имела стиральной машинки и всегда стирала вручную. Сейчас пришли сильные холода и Шахнозе становится все труднее справляться со стиркой. Она поставила себе цель и хочет купить стиральную машинку как можно скорее. Она обещает выплачивать кредит в срок и без опозданий. Вы можете сейчас помочь Шахнозе.
texts.en:
Shahnoza lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is married and has a two-year-old son. Her husband works as a taxi driver and Shahnoza works as a seamstress in one of the city's ateliers. She started this occupation four years ago. Her aunt taught her how to sew and she is thankful to her to this day.

The reason Shahnoza is requesting a loan is to buy a washing machine. She has never had one and always does her laundry by hand. It's now gotten very cold and it has become more and more difficult for her to get the laundry done. She has set herself a goal and wants to buy a washing machine as soon as possible. She promises to pay back the loan on time. You can help her right now.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calves to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Kuanyshbek

texts.ru: Куанышбек, 37 лет, женат, 2 детей. У Куанышбека среднее образование, он занимается сельским хозяйством. У него есть 1 дойная корова, 2 бычка и 3 овцы. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Куанышбек обратился в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Куанышбек будет использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также он хочет накопить средства на покупку земельной доли, чтобы начать заниматься полеводством.
texts.en: Kuanyshbek is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children. Kuanyshbek has a secondary education. He works in agriculture and farming. He has 1 dairy cow, 2 bull-calves and 3 sheep on his farm. For the further development of his farm, Kuanyshbek turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." He is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy bull-calves to fatten up and resell. Kuanyshbek plans to use the earnings from the loan to further develop his farm. He also wants to save money to buy a plot of land so he can begin crop farming.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves for fattening up and reselling.
